commit_message:
Add node_staging_uri parameter

Adding node_staging_uri parameter to set the staging location
to /var/lib/staging/glance instead of the default one /tmp/staging
as it would be a shared across the nodes in case of 'glance-direct'
image import method.

Change-Id: Id9b35d5781448f22549d741ab797f656f96c6562
Closes-Bug: #1765439

subject: Trivial: Expose scope param in API ref
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 12:27:32.000000000', 'message': 'Trivial: Expose scope param in API ref

Workflows PUT/POST (update/create) APIs support this
parameter but API documentation does not include it.
Also, mention potentially erroneous behaviour of PUT API i.e.
updating wf which was in public scope without passing scope=public
makes it private.

Change-Id: Iace1eb6ec523a32239157fba9fad93d3f43a4fbe
'}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Expose scope param in API ref

Workflows PUT/POST (update/create) APIs support this
parameter but API documentation does not include it.
Also, mention potentially erroneous behaviour of PUT API i.e.
updating wf which was in public scope without passing scope=public
makes it private.

Change-Id: Iace1eb6ec523a32239157fba9fad93d3f43a4fbe

I'll push the updated patch in this week, anyway."}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-05 06:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-05 06:24:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I said I planned to change the recovery check interval to gradually increase like 60 secs, 120 secs, 240 secs, 480 secs, .... However, it complicates implementation considering restart. I mean, if the monitor thread is stuck and restarted, how long the recovery check interval should be?

To simplify the implementation and make monitor resilient, I introduced the periodic healing mechanism instead. Please see the document (Healing section of doc/source/user/resource-monitoring.rst) in detail.

I've not yet updated unit tests but want to hear how you think of this approach."}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-03-16 08:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-03-30 00:51:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-25 05:13:13.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce time windows for host reservation healing

This patch adds the following time windows:

* Immediate recovery time: If any host fails, related active
  reservations and reservations which will start in this time window
  are healed immediately.

* Extra recovery time: If a failed host does not recover in the
  immediate recovery time, related reservations which will start in this
  time window are healed. The failed host is periodically
  checked with this interval until it recovers or all of related
  allocations are migrated.

These two time windows are configurable.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: I6971c952fcde101ff2408f567fee9a7dab97b140
'}, {'created': '2018-02-05 06:08:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add periodic healing

This patch adds a periodic healing mechanism into the monitor module and
monitoring plugins. With this change, the heal_reservations() method of
resource plugin was changed to receive a period (start/end_date
arguments) to heal.

This change is for not healing (reallocating) all of reservations for
failed resources immediately because failed resources are expected to
recover sometime in the future. The monitor tries to heal only
reservations which are active or will start soon. Remaining reservations
are expected to be healed by the periodic healing if needed.

Partially Implements: blueprint resource-monitoring
Change-Id: I6971c952fcde101ff2408f567fee9a7dab97b140
'}, {'created': '2018-03-16 08:09:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add periodic healing

commit_message:
Add periodic healing

This patch adds a periodic healing mechanism into the monitor module and
monitoring plugins. With this change, the heal_reservations() method of
resource plugin was changed to receive a period (start/end_date
arguments) to heal.

This change is for not healing (reallocating) all of reservations for
failed resources immediately because failed resources are expected to
recover sometime in the future. The monitor tries to heal only
reservations which are active or will start soon. Remaining reservations
are expected to be healed by the periodic healing.

Implements: blueprint healing-time
Change-Id: I6971c952fcde101ff2408f567fee9a7dab97b140

commit_message:
Move prepare_container_images to utils

Moving prepare_container_images to utils will allow us to re-use the
code for other use cases than undercloud_deploy.

For example, we would like to create a CloudImagePrepare class to
prepare containers and upload to a registry when needed. Rather than
duplicating the code, let's re-use what was done in undercloud_deploy.

Change-Id: I0dcfe6a6dc68fef54fbc21689cf54d37b3b2b0b3

the box like it's the case for instack-undercloud.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 05:58:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix initialization of the PhysicalHostMonitorPlugin

The PhysicalHostMonitorPlugin class uses the singleton design pattern.
An instance of this class is generated only once but __init__ can be
called multiple times.

This patch moves class member initialization from __init__ to __new__.

commit_message:
Fix initialization of the PhysicalHostMonitorPlugin

The PhysicalHostMonitorPlugin class uses the singleton design pattern.
An instance of this class is generated only once but __init__ can be
called multiple times.

This patch moves class member initialization from __init__ to __new__.

Change-Id: I999e5e27d0fda51297fffd2f75e29efb3b464061

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

python-blazarclient 1.0.0 is not available on PyPI,
so the minimum version is bumped to 1.0.1.

Change-Id: Icbecf09ff90d7b5e563df27fe1d8db2438ac6c4a
Co-Authored-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-07 00:46:02.000000000', 'message': 'Do not for force-reinstall when upgrading packages

Using fore-reinstall is causing problems with other projects,
as it may cause pip to reinstall certifi, and overwrite any
modifications made to the certificates.

Change-Id: Ibb6578f45f9277f97ca61b60714c8ce2b4eacb61
'}, {'created': '2018-05-07 01:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'Do not for force-reinstall when upgrading packages

Using fore-reinstall with upgrade will cause all
dependencies to always be reinstalled. This can
cause issues when other components install Senlin
as a dependency.

In this case we are causing issues because we are
re-installing certify, a file that is modified by
devstack after installation to make sure that the
system has the appropriate ssl certificates.

See the function fix_system_ca_bundle_path in devstack
for more information.

Change-Id: Ibb6578f45f9277f97ca61b60714c8ce2b4eacb61
'}, {'created': '2018-05-07 01:17:10.000000000', 'message': 'Do not for force-reinstall when upgrading packages

Using fore-reinstall with upgrade will cause all

cause issues when other components install Senlin
as a dependency.

In this case we are causing issues because we are
re-installing certify, a file that is modified by
devstack after installation to make sure that the
system has the appropriate ssl certificates.

See the function fix_system_ca_bundle_path in devstack
for more information.

Change-Id: Ibb6578f45f9277f97ca61b60714c8ce2b4eacb61
Closes-Bug: #1769541
'}]
commit_message:
Do not for force-reinstall when upgrading packages

Using fore-reinstall with upgrade will cause all
dependencies to always be reinstalled. This can
cause issues when other components install Senlin
as a dependency.

In this case we are causing issues because we are
re-installing certify, a file that is modified by
devstack after installation to make sure that the
system has the appropriate ssl certificates.

See the function fix_system_ca_bundle_path in devstack
for more information.

Change-Id: Ibb6578f45f9277f97ca61b60714c8ce2b4eacb61
Closes-Bug: #1769541

(6 comments)

My preference based on solutions would be:

1. alternative 1
2. alternative 2 + add in_tree query param to GET /allocation_candidates
3. the current proposed solution that's already in here which re-introduces bug 1750623 (actually I wouldn't consider that a solution...)"}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-19 18:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

i would prefer using alternative #1 if there is lot of pushback against the proposed solution as long as the issue brought up by alex can be addressed somehow....'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-04-20 04:11:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Matt, if we are going to #2, we can use a requested_destination field of request spec obj, and as you said use member_of, then the nova scheduler won't have any knowledge about the action is rebuild or something else.

I guess we need to merge the allocations before claim?

And I feel we have bug for the evacuate a instance with specific host and force=false, it will bypass the 'GET /allocation_candidates', that means the traits in the request won't be validated by placement when evacuate to a new host.

I need to verify that."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 18:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I guess we need to merge the allocations before claim?

There is no claim for rebuild. A rebuild does not move the instance to another host. That's evacuate.

> And I feel we have bug for the evacuate a instance with specific host and force=false, it will bypass the 'GET /allocation_candidates', that means the traits in the request won't be validated by placement when evacuate to a new host.

Evacuate issues are orthogonal to this spec update which is about rebuild where we don't move the instance. Also, I assume you meant "force=True". If you evacuate with a target host but force=False, we validate the requested target host in the scheduler and make a claim on that host since it's a move operation. If you specify force=True, then we bypass the scheduler, however, we still create allocations on the forced dest host:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/7f6fbe0e198114a874a0695e007f1672758b3d65/nova/conductor/manager.py#L832'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 18:38:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Furthermore, regarding evacuate with a forced host, yes we claim the resources on the dest host:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/7f6fbe0e198114a874a0695e007f1672758b3d65/nova/conductor/manager.py#L832

But that doesn't do any trait filtering which GET /allocation_candidates would normally do. However, if the admin is forcing the dest host, then they are doing that at their own risk - this is why we have warnings in the API reference about using the force option for evacuate and live migrate and why I blocked Takashi's spec for adding force to cold migrate, because it's a mess."}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-21 01:01:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-21 01:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

+---------------------+
               |   HOST              |
               |   traits=CUSTOM_XYZ |
               +----------+----------+
                          |
         +----------------+-----------------+
         |                                  |
         |                                  |
+--------+--------+           +-------------+-----------+
|                 |           |                         |
|    SRIOV_VF:1   |           |        SRIOV_VF:2       |
|                 |           | traits=HW_NIC_OFFLOAD_X |
+-----------------+           +-------------------------+

Instance launches initially with image1(no traits) and resources=SRIOV_VF.

Instance rebuild launches with image2(HW_NIC_OFFLOAD_XX) and resources=SRIOV_VF, traits=HW_NIC_OFFLOAD_XX

Scenario 1

Initial instance launch happens with resources=SRIOV_VF and SRIOV_VF:2 allocated.

Expected: Successful launch. Rebuild is not an issue since no need to change allocation.

Proposed solution - reject request in case traits have changed from original image
Result: Fail to launch since image1 and image2 traits do not match

Alternative #1 - Use GET /resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/traits
Result: Successful launch assuming we get all the nested traits as well.
Quoting efried basically something like this:
 > for rp in GET /resource_providers?in_tree={uuid}:
 >    traits += GET /resource_providers/$rp.uuid/traits

Alternative #2 - modify `GET /allocation_candidates` add in_tree parameter and make resources optional
Result: Successful launch. The GET calls returns only the current host and we accept.

Scenario 2

Initial instance launch happens with SRIOV_VF:1 allocated.

Expected: Fail to launch. Rebuild should fail since new allocation needs to be made against SRIOV_VF:2 as the requirement for traits=HW_NIC_OFFLOAD_XX forces us to select that resource.

Proposed solution - reject request in case traits have changed from original image
Result: Fail to launch since image1 and image2 traits do not match.

Alternative #1 - Use GET /resource_providers/{rp_uuid}/traits
Result: Successful launch. The GET calls returns all the traits so we accept. But we want the request to fail since SRIOV_VF:2 is not allocated for this instance.

Alternative #2 - modify `GET /allocation_candidates` add in_tree parameter and make resources optional
Result: Successful launch. The GET calls returns only the current host and we accept. But we want the request to fail since SRIOV_VF:2 is not allocated for this instance.

My proposed changes in PS4 does not work since it is a requirement that for rebuild we have to use the same host or fail in case the same host cannot be used.

I think there are issues with both alternative approaches especially in scenario 2. If we dont care about allocation in scenario 2, then Alternative #1 is the best solution with least impact and hacks.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:49:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I've posted what I think is a summary of the issue and discussed alternatives in the mailing list:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129726.html"}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-03 23:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-03 23:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Good.'}, {'account_id': 17190, 'date': '2018-05-04 16:24:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-05-04 20:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Seems to capture the outcome of the ML discussion so lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-05-04 21:07:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2018-05-07 01:50:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)

After reading the ML, I agree the case Matt and Melanie raised. And this can remove the rebuild logic out of scheduler. So I'm cool with this."}]

commit_message:
Handle rebuild of instance with new image

Add a paragraph describing how we can handle rebuild of instances
while changing either the image or the image traits.

commit_message:
Add endpoint type specifications to murano config

Setting endpoint_type to internalURL in the murano config allows murano
to work properly when using self-signed certificates.

Change-Id: I5873f92994d790d597ec5e97163bbf8001c362b9

commit_message:
Rename fernet_utils to token_utils

This change renames the fernet_utils from keystone.common to
token_utils in order to provide more generic tools for the
implementation of alternative token providers.

Change-Id: I85091709ed4ed7bdd2c2d053e342e4b1b615ef08

subject: Use microversion 2.60 when attaching a multiattach volume
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-25 19:40:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-25 21:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-26 12:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-26 14:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-26 14:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-27 10:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:19:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I patched this into horizon on my master-level (rocky) devstack and was able to successfully attach a multiattach-capable volume to a server instance. I'll try patching nova-api to say that 2.60 isn't available to see the failure."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-27 11:28:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I patched nova-api to say that the max version was 2.59, restarted the nova-api service, and tried to attach the multiattach volume and got the error in the instances panel that multiattach volumes are not yet supported, as expected.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-27 13:48:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I tried to test multi volume attach using CLI before testing it in horizon, but I failed an error that multiattach is not supported by the instance. Is there any requirements to test multi-attach volumes? I am using nova API 2.60.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/686585/'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-27 14:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I use Ubuntu 16.04 and noticed libvirt and qemu versions do not satisfy the requirements... Is there any convenient way to test it?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-27 15:20:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I tested the patch and found several things to be improved for full support of multi-attach volumes.

* Depending on qemu and libvirt versions, even though the nova API and volume multiattach attribute say the multi-attach is supported, there is a case where the multiattach cannot be used. We need to raise a clearer error message for that case. At now, "Unable to attach volume." is shown.
* multi-attachable volumes attached to other instances are not listed in "Attach Volume" form from the instance table.
* "Manage attachments" action of the volume table needs to take into account multi-attachable volumes.
* allow_multiattach attribute needs to be specified during volume creation.

I can help the effort.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-27 15:30:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It turns out it is not limited to nova APi version used. I filed a blueprint to track the feature of multi-attached volume https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/multi-attach-volume'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-28 16:32:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Here is a demo (with a link to slides) on how to setup devstack for multiattach support:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hZg6wqxdEHk'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-28 16:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Depending on qemu and libvirt versions, even though the nova API and volume multiattach attribute say the multi-attach is supported, there is a case where the multiattach cannot be used. We need to raise a clearer error message for that case. At now, "Unable to attach volume." is shown.

This is true of all sorts of compute API features depending on (1) which virt driver you're using and/or (2) which version of the compute node(s) in your deployment. Nova needs to grow a capabilities API to give horizon that information.

> multi-attachable volumes attached to other instances are not listed in "Attach Volume" form from the instance table.

OK - separate patch though?

> "Manage attachments" action of the volume table needs to take into account multi-attachable volumes.

OK, is that a separate patch? Could this be done in a series of changes so that we don't have one really huge complicated patch?

> allow_multiattach attribute needs to be specified during volume creation.

The Cinder team has 'deprecated' the volume.multiattach attribute during volume creation. They want users to use a multiattach extra spec on the volume type to indicate multiattach support, and then use volume type when creating the volume (see my demo).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-28 16:43:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Depending on qemu and libvirt versions, even though the nova API and volume multiattach attribute say the multi-attach is supported, there is a case where the multiattach cannot be used. We need to raise a clearer error message for that case. At now, "Unable to attach volume." is shown.

To be clear, the volume.mulitattach flag just means the volume type for the volume supports multiattach (the storage backend). That's unrelated to nova.

The compute API will give you different errors based on multiattach when trying to attaching a multiattach volume:

1. 2.60 isn't used - you get a 400 error message that 2.60+ is required

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/4bac420d85044b92df2be052b5795ae454d497e2/nova/api/openstack/compute/volumes.py#L352

2. the compute (or virt driver) aren't new enough or don't support multiattach - the compute API will give you a specific 409 error message:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/4bac420d85044b92df2be052b5795ae454d497e2/nova/api/openstack/compute/volumes.py#L342-L343'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-14 13:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

LGTM. I'm going to test it before +2"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-10 13:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Sorry for late.

> > multi-attachable volumes attached to other instances are not listed in "Attach Volume" form from the instance table.
> OK - separate patch though?
> > "Manage attachments" action of the volume table needs to take into account multi-attachable volumes.
> OK, is that a separate patch? Could this be done in a series of changes so that we don't have one really huge complicated patch?

I am fine with separate patches.
Could you use https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/multi-attach-volume?

> > allow_multiattach attribute needs to be specified during volume creation.
> The Cinder team has 'deprecated' the volume.multiattach attribute during volume creation. They want users to use a multiattach extra spec on the volume type to indicate multiattach support, and then use volume type when creating the volume (see my demo).

Thanks for clarification.
Following your demo, I understood the workflow using multi-attach volumes and succeeded to play with multi-attach volumes.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-10 16:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(repost due to some formatting issue. It seems I forgot to add new line between lines)

> > multi-attachable volumes attached to other instances are not listed in "Attach Volume" form from the instance table.

> OK - separate patch though?

> > "Manage attachments" action of the volume table needs to take into account multi-attachable volumes.

> OK, is that a separate patch? Could this be done in a series of changes so that we don't have one really huge complicated patch?

I am fine with separate patches.
Could you use https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/multi-attach-volume?

> > allow_multiattach attribute needs to be specified during volume creation.

> The Cinder team has 'deprecated' the volume.multiattach attribute during volume creation. They want users to use a multiattach extra spec on the volume type to indicate multiattach support, and then use volume type when creating the volume (see my demo).

Thanks for clarification.
Following your demo, I understood the workflow using multi-attach volumes and succeeded to play with multi-attach volumes.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-10 17:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-10 17:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-10 20:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-11 12:53:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-11 14:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Matt, is it okay to assign you as the assignee of blueprint multi-attach-volume?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:29:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Matt, is it okay to assign you as the assignee of blueprint multi-attach-volume?

I likely can't work on all of the changes listed in that blueprint given I'm not very familiar with Horizon code."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:30:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I likely can't work on all of the changes listed in that blueprint given I'm not very familiar with Horizon code.

Heh, I guess the list of changes that need to be made aren't even in the blueprint, so we'd have to figure out what that list is first. If the blueprint is just this change, then yeah I can be the owner."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-25 07:00:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Matt Riedemann wrote:

> > I likely can't work on all of the changes listed in that blueprint given I'm not very familiar with Horizon code.
>
> Heh, I guess the list of changes that need to be made aren't even in
> the blueprint, so we'd have to figure out what that list is first.
> If the blueprint is just this change, then yeah I can be the owner.

My intention of the blueprint I registered is to cover multi-attach volume support including volume management. I am okay to be an owner of it, but I am not confident I can spend enough time in Rokcy timeframe. If someone is interested in the blueprint of supporting the multi-attach volume support, it would be great, so I would like to leave the assignee unassinged."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-04-25 13:18:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I'm OK to get this merged and create and implement rest of features in the blueprint.

It would be good to have TODOs list in the blueprint"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-25 13:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> It would be good to have TODOs list in the blueprint

Done.'}, {'account_id': 26240, 'date': '2018-05-06 23:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

done'}]

commit_message:
Use microversion 2.60 when attaching a multiattach volume

Multiattach capable volumes can only be attached with microversion
2.60 or later, so this checks if the volume being attached is
multiattach capable and if microversion 2.60 is available, use it.

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Closes-Bug: #1751564

Change-Id: If708e3edb05cff6e93cfc3dfccb91b1441dcd181

commit_message:
Remove try-catch from test_data imports

python-manilaclient>=1.16.0, lower constrain for manila-ui,
has support for v2. For this reason, the imports try-catch
in test_data is no longer needed.

Change-Id: Ic73137a1cc5356684d32578ddd1f49690bc5e515

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 18:28:56.000000000', 'message': 'Do not remove conntrack jump rules if no zone

In corner cases, the firewall code could try and remove
non-existent conntrack zone jump rules if a zone has never
been allocated.  This could happen on an agent restart
when there are no longer ports in the zone on the
compute node.  Skip the removal since it will just generate
an iptables warning complaining the existing rule does
not exist.

Change-Id: Ie32733b4a06b6d75cf1eb78915a510a4bb78f619
Closes-bug: #1765208
'}, {'created': '2018-04-24 14:41:55.000000000', 'message': 'Do not remove conntrack jump rules if no zone

In corner cases, the firewall code could try and remove
non-existent conntrack zone jump rules if a zone has never
been allocated.  This could happen on an agent restart
when there are no longer ports in the zone on the
compute node.  Skip the removal since it will just generate
an iptables warning complaining the existing rule does
not exist.

Change-Id: Ie32733b4a06b6d75cf1eb78915a510a4bb78f619
Closes-bug: #1765208
'}]
commit_message:
Do not remove conntrack jump rules if no zone

In corner cases, the firewall code could try and remove
non-existent conntrack zone jump rules if a zone has never
been allocated.  This could happen on an agent restart
when there are no longer ports in the zone on the
compute node.  Skip the removal since it will just generate
an iptables warning complaining the existing rule does
not exist.

Change-Id: Ie32733b4a06b6d75cf1eb78915a510a4bb78f619
Closes-bug: #1765208

commit_message:
Base test module/class for functional placement db

Initial change set factoring a common base test class and helper
utilities out of test_resource_provider and test_allocation_candidates.
This one minimizes the delta by copying some module-level symbols into
the test suites.  Subsequent patches will refactor to avoid this, clean
up naming (so we're not accessing privates from another module), and use
the now-common utility methods in more places.

Change-Id: Ibd38a3903a2d347a4ff4702d0d1172f6e37e7d19

commit_message:
New application framework

Add initial scaffolding to support applications with non-hard-coded
table names and registers.

Includes:

* 'wiring' configuration (vertices and edges)

* Decorator for new applications, with States, Entrypoints, Exitpoints,
  and public and private variables.

Includes code for reading and parsing this information, and connecting
the 'external' tables, i.e. the exitpoints of one app to the entrypoint
if the next app.

Change-Id: I81ee47b0c6e741888b3446602cca5e1835c9ae2f
Related-Bug: #1738986
Co-Authored-By: Lihi Wishnitzer <lihiwish@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Delegate database tasks to galera_server

With the implementation of [1] the MySQL-python package is
no longer present on the service container. Given that all
other services have the playbook execute these tasks with
delegation to the first galera_server container, we can do
that here too.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/562276

Change-Id: I2c70ac1324ea027ae4a8ed1e70c5706b47fcd57f
(cherry picked from commit 64f7e7001a43f9c875efabca411b9b8426637738)

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Id29497b36cd2b9cca3f3b08474e1001d528931b6
Partial-Bug: #1764470
(cherry picked from commit 94b71a3b0a7a57e3f86915a40dee0c6fd4715ccc)

subject: Reload systemd units when restarting service
messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-05-05 23:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-06 10:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-05-06 10:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-05 23:05:55.000000000', 'message': 'Reload systemd units when restarting service

During upgrades, if the systemd unit is not reloaded, then the
service is restarted with the existing definition which means
that the new service is never started.

Change-Id: I2dd01cffa14eed4c5982dc93395622a00b8ac4c6
'}]
commit_message:
Reload systemd units when restarting service

During upgrades, if the systemd unit is not reloaded, then the
service is restarted with the existing definition which means
that the new service is never started.

Change-Id: I2dd01cffa14eed4c5982dc93395622a00b8ac4c6

commit_message:
Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

Change-Id: Iff9971b5508425e809b0a1ccfe40af04252aa014
(cherry picked from commit 04b2ff1f003f9b9ccd73a9a81c50b132c86ddd72)

defaults: Allow uwsgi to autoload required plugins.

Distributions normally package uwsgi in a modular fashion so we need
to be use the 'autoload' option to allow it to load all the required
plugins.

commit_message:
defaults: Allow uwsgi to autoload required plugins.

Distributions normally package uwsgi in a modular fashion so we need
to be use the 'autoload' option to allow it to load all the required
plugins.

Change-Id: I384e08353910c7edf7ead0ce4b42c943e73aba55
Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages

[{'created': '2018-05-04 09:10:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logger invocation in DeleteImage

correct method name is getLogger (camel-case).
Beside not workin for zunclient itself, in particular it also breaks
openstackclient bash completion in presence of zunclient.

Change-Id: I5aa6916e0bd2b16bc0f64ab2bda523bb5ee1f5dd
Related-Bug: #1762316
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logger invocation in DeleteImage

correct method name is getLogger (camel-case).
Beside not workin for zunclient itself, in particular it also breaks
openstackclient bash completion in presence of zunclient.

Change-Id: I5aa6916e0bd2b16bc0f64ab2bda523bb5ee1f5dd
Related-Bug: #1762316

commit_message:
Fix entrypoints for quotas

currently they are pointing to non-existing code/classes which breaks
all sort of things, including bash completion in openstackclient.

Change-Id: I89e266b9d85f4168fd593ad9a05878b902e5315e
Closes-Bug: #1762316

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 12:26:05.000000000', 'message': 'Separate db_change_logic loop from nb_api

To be able to handle pubsub events (namely through db_change_callback)
the nb_api forced the user to call the process_changes() method which is
a blocking loop.
This is unusable for applications that do other things or have event
loops of their own.
In this patch this logic was moved to the local_controller as it is
specific to this use-case, and now the nb_api exposes a
register_db_change_callback method for this use case.
As a result of this change, there is no need to use the is_external_app
flag, as all it does is makes sure the subscriber is not initialized,
which happens now if the register_db_change_callback is not called.

Change-Id: I2b02fde8018f0ac209175beadf75bbb20a6480d6
'}, {'created': '2018-04-26 13:16:00.000000000', 'message': 'Separate db_change_logic loop from nb_api

As a result of this change, there is no need to use the is_external_app

which happens now if the register_db_change_callback is not called.

commit_message:
Separate db_change_logic loop from nb_api

To be able to handle pubsub events (namely through db_change_callback)
the nb_api forced the user to call the process_changes() method which is
a blocking loop.
This is unusable for applications that do other things or have event
loops of their own.
In this patch this logic was moved to the local_controller as it is
specific to this use-case, and now the nb_api exposes a
register_db_change_callback method for this use case.
As a result of this change, there is no need to use the is_external_app
flag, as all it does is makes sure the subscriber is not initialized,
which happens now if the register_db_change_callback is not called.

Change-Id: I2b02fde8018f0ac209175beadf75bbb20a6480d6

commit_message:
[DNM] ceph-nfs: disable ganesha caching

When using ceph-ansible to setup Ganesha as CephFS's gateway,
disable Ganesha's caching so that Ganesha doesn't cache the
same information that libcephfs clients do.

Change-Id: Ibbd2c80931014cffa4580111070a97ea6df3a430

[{'created': '2018-05-03 16:36:43.000000000', 'message': 'doc: Clarify network types compatible with physnets

Per my understanding, only flat or VLAN networks make sense for physical
networks, a.k.a. physnets. However, the docs specifically mentioned only
GRE and local networks as being incompatible. Add VXLAN to this list to
complete it.

Change-Id: I7915f129bfc8436b410455507ead641a64a51bc7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
doc: Clarify network types compatible with physnets

Per my understanding, only flat or VLAN networks make sense for physical
networks, a.k.a. physnets. However, the docs specifically mentioned only
GRE and local networks as being incompatible. Add VXLAN to this list to
complete it.

Change-Id: I7915f129bfc8436b410455507ead641a64a51bc7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-04 13:18:48.000000000', 'message': 'Barbican: Correct endpoint creation

This PS corrects the barbican endpoint creation to use the correct
(ie None) paths for the keystone service catalog. The chart as-is
does not work with many clients that expect the correct keystone
endpoint, and thus make calls to http://barbican.foo/v1/v1, even
with newton era clients.

* https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/key-manager/ocata/install-ubuntu.html

* https://docs.openstack.org/barbican/pike/install/install-ubuntu.html
* https://docs.openstack.org/barbican/queens/install/install-ubuntu.html

commit_message:
Barbican: Correct endpoint creation

This PS corrects the barbican endpoint creation to use the correct
(ie None) paths for the keystone service catalog. The chart as-is
does not work with many clients that expect the correct keystone
endpoint, and thus make calls to http://barbican.foo/v1/v1, even
with newton era clients.

* https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/key-manager/ocata/install-ubuntu.html
* https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/key-manager/newton/install-ubuntu.html
* https://docs.openstack.org/barbican/pike/install/install-ubuntu.html
* https://docs.openstack.org/barbican/queens/install/install-ubuntu.html

Change-Id: I84e8d19a682b901ecc76a2281d24f60c749577a8

commit_message:
Add more infos into error message

It is way more convenient to tell the user exactly how much
space was found and what is the minimal size required instead
of forcing him to go through the source code.

Change-Id: I6aafca34ba9dc3a3a45a3ac01848eefeca2ad03d

commit_message:
Use test_base symbols directly

The preceding patch brought in symbols from the test_base module to
minimize the delta.  This patch removes these, renames the private ones
to be public, and changes all their usages to reference them from
test_base directly.

Change-Id: I43b7cfe9dbcb6de607f0c166b065a1ec3543c256

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 00:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-cell negative test for cold migration with target host

This adds a functional test which runs two cells, one host per
cell, and attempts to cold migrate an instance from the host
in one cell to the host in the other cell, which is blocked
by the scheduler and will result in a NoValidHost exception.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint cold-migration-with-target-queens

Change-Id: I76db5a6cd38c3c407102d8dc03beb6a4db782454

commit_message:
Add multi-cell negative test for cold migration with target host

This adds a functional test which runs two cells, one host per
cell, and attempts to cold migrate an instance from the host
in one cell to the host in the other cell, which fails in the
API with ComputeHostNotFound because the context is targeted
to the cell where the instance lives, so it won't be able to
find the targeted host in the other cell.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Part of blueprint cold-migration-with-target-queens

Change-Id: I76db5a6cd38c3c407102d8dc03beb6a4db782454

commit_message:
Remove redundant config bond-with-vlans/compute-dpdk.j2.yaml

The compute-dpdk.j2.yaml template was originally present because
the NIC config file name generated was compute-ovs-dpdk.yaml.
We added deprecated_nic_config_name to network_data.yaml so
this file is automatically generated by role.role.j2.yaml, but
never removed this file.

Depends-On: I68b6e674d6aa86aa7d60efa3eb7b3cb874171e63
Change-Id: Ibcd9d716351f4dc6f2c720f132a124536a01f8dc

commit_message:
Add a 'trash_output' flag to ansible playbook action

Sometimes, the output is REALLY big. It ends up throwing an error in
MySQL trying to write to the output of the ActionExecution to the
database. Since we're passing the output back via zaqar, we can
just throw this away.

The trash_output flag defaults to false, to maintain the original
behavior.

Change-Id: Id13c7cf52b306891d780243b2562c8ca305aa365
Closes-Bug: #1768913

subject: Fix Formatter subclasses for Python 3.2+
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27671, 'name': 'Dmitry Grachev', 'email': 'dmitry.a.grachev@gmail.com', 'username': 'suff'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-17 07:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-17 07:52:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The change looks OK. Can you provide any hints about how to test it? It would be good to have an automated unit test for it even.'}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-18 08:24:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For a correct check, it's enough to call the formatter class (for python3.5). If we don't get trace - it's ok. Now we don't have that tests?"}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-18 08:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

But test in https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/master/oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py#L410 looks Ok for validate JSONFormatter class.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:42:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> For a correct check, it's enough to call the formatter class (for
 > python3.5). If we don't get trace - it's ok. Now we don't have that
 > tests?

Correct. We need a test that fails without this fix but works when you include it"}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-19 13:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually to get trace, we need to call config.fileConfig(fname) from logging with JSONFormatter.'}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-26 19:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-27 08:54:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-28 09:23:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2018-01-31 07:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Test is complete.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-01-31 22:08:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

The functional change looks good and does indeed fix the problem in my local tests.  However, I do have some suggestions for changes in the unit test to make it cleaner and easier to debug if it does fail.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-03 09:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-05-03 09:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-03 16:18:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

For the purposes of unit testing I suppose we could just create instances of both formatter classes and pass style to them.  We don't really need to test the actual fileConfig code, just the api it's calling in this project.

That obviously wouldn't catch any new parameters that Python would pass in the future, but at least it would verify we don't break the existing interface.  Maybe we could add a devstack job that configures everything to use the JSONFormatter as a way to further test this code?  That might be a good thing for this project anyway.

That said, I'm not inclined to block this on either a trivial unit test for something we're unlikely to break or a non-trivial test job addition."}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-05-05 11:58:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 07:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix JSONFormatter class for current working with Python3.5

Change-Id: I9b339163ddfe440bc6782ced33595a0dcf60f658
Closed-Bug: 1739743
'}, {'created': '2018-01-26 19:34:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix JSONFormatter class for current working with Python3.5

Change-Id: I9b339163ddfe440bc6782ced33595a0dcf60f658
Closed-Bug: 1739743
'}, {'created': '2018-01-27 08:54:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix JSONFormatter class for current working with Python3.5

Change-Id: I9b339163ddfe440bc6782ced33595a0dcf60f658
Closed-Bug: 1739743
'}, {'created': '2018-01-28 09:23:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix JSONFormatter class for current working with Python3.5

Change-Id: I9b339163ddfe440bc6782ced33595a0dcf60f658
Closed-Bug: 1739743
'}, {'created': '2018-05-03 09:16:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix Formatter subclasses for Python 3.2+

Python 3.2 added the 'style' parameter to 'logging.Formatter.__init__'.
This is provided by 'logging.config.fileConfig' meaning this currently
raises a 'TypeError' similar to the below when the incompatible
formatters, JSONFormatter and FluentFormatter, are used with Python 3.2
or greater.

  TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'style'

Resolve this by simply adding the parameter to the list. There is more
work we can do here (like actually supporting this parameter) but that's
a job for another patch.

Note that we can't actually test this as doing so would involve invoking
'logging.config.fileConfig', which in turn would modify the global state
of the 'logging' module. You can thank the singleton pattern for that.

Change-Id: I9b339163ddfe440bc6782ced33595a0dcf60f658
Closes-Bug: 1739743
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Formatter subclasses for Python 3.2+

Python 3.2 added the 'style' parameter to 'logging.Formatter.__init__'.
This is provided by 'logging.config.fileConfig' meaning this currently
raises a 'TypeError' similar to the below when the incompatible
formatters, JSONFormatter and FluentFormatter, are used with Python 3.2
or greater.

  TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'style'

Resolve this by simply adding the parameter to the list. There is more
work we can do here (like actually supporting this parameter) but that's
a job for another patch.

Note that we can't actually test this as doing so would involve invoking
'logging.config.fileConfig', which in turn would modify the global state
of the 'logging' module. You can thank the singleton pattern for that.

Change-Id: I9b339163ddfe440bc6782ced33595a0dcf60f658
Closes-Bug: 1739743
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove stale pip-missing-reqs and pypy tox tests

pip_missing_reqs tool is no longer maintained and has broken with
release 10 of pip

Refer to:
 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/130027.html

commit_message:
Cap SecretStorage based on python version.

We don't actually directly depend on SecretStorage but 3.X only supports
py >= 3.5 so we need to track it here to ensure we get the right
version based on our python.

NOTE(tonyb): We pick the current value in upper-constraints as the
minimum.

Change-Id: I7c826924c2b1c9ff48e70f7205c6a0e775338db7
(cherry picked from commit 6b1b63dd0bcda999a63d892146dea3dd9fb89a3c)

commit_message:
audit and request_context entities made part of AuditHandler class

Because these 2 entities are passed as arguments through all
AuditHandler's methods, they are made members of AuditHandler. This
commit makes appropriate changes.

Important thing is that ContinuousAuditHandler still has methods that
doesn't work with current audit but processing list of audits. These
methods left their signatures untouched.

Partially Implements: bp watcher-planner-selector

Change-Id: I4abba0eddb2b8e451b6ff615146f82b61e03dc7f

commit_message:
Update documentation to include usage for new projects

The oslo.policy bits to generate documentation and use the oslo.policy
CLI scripts is usually copy/pasted from other services that have
already done that work. This commit attempts to pull that information
into the usage section of oslo.policy, complete with examples, instead
of making OpenStack developers hunt through projects to find examples
they can use. Or wonder why or how this tooling works.

Change-Id: Ie74888b09bb836c192a88c5beddd86297c8bceda
Closes-Bug: 1766953

[{'created': '2018-05-04 18:23:45.000000000', 'message': 'Set log_facility, log_level in obj expirer

Object expirer does not have log_facility set explicitly
and defaults to LOG_LOCAL0, thus logging to /var/log/messages
All other swift services have been set to LOG_LOCAL2. This

commit_message:
Set log_facility, log_level in obj expirer

Object expirer does not have log_facility set explicitly
and defaults to LOG_LOCAL0, thus logging to /var/log/messages
All other swift services have been set to LOG_LOCAL2. This
patch changes object expirer to LOG_LOCAL2.

Change-Id: I037090eecc9832e7c7397a5a9e52df4a23f6c16e
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move o-hm0 dhcp config under /etc/dhcp

Apparmor will block dhclient from accessing the o-hm0 configuration file
under /etc/octavia. This patch moves our dhclient.conf under /etc/dhcp/octavia
to allow the dhclient to access the file when apparmor is running.

Change-Id: I3153f8bd9237470f406a9edeb4e2a0767fc747b8
Story: 1673269
Task: 5434
(cherry picked from commit ae1ab563e54be81b723cfd6f619d500e2de94835)

[{'created': '2018-04-13 00:38:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add the Xenial jobs to gate

The Xenial jobs were switched to voting but were not added back in the gate.   This patch fixes that.

Thanks to the work by Tobias to get Ubuntu going again.

Change-Id: I6c521333dc8cd62c36f434a89aaee86da6a3c323

commit_message:
Add the Xenial jobs to gate

The Xenial jobs were switched to voting but were not added back in the gate.   This patch fixes that.

Thanks to the work by Tobias to get Ubuntu going again.

Change-Id: I6c521333dc8cd62c36f434a89aaee86da6a3c323

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 12:53:15.000000000', 'message': 'Wire-in net_config_override

It allows to override network configs and maintains parity
with instack. Overrides as well custom_env_files, if any.

Partial-bug: #1763337

Change-Id: I3b59abc839ec6c709e5fd24652610a5fac58ee57
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-04-26 11:51:13.000000000', 'message': 'Wire-in net_config_override

Allow to override network configs and maintain parity
with instack.

net_config_override takes higher data precedence over
custom_env_files and t-h-t UndercloudNetConfigOverride.

Instack templated j2 tags are allowed to be used as well,
which smooths upgrading paths from instack. Known instack_env
to heat params or config opts mappings provide the context for
legacy instack templates processing.

Partial-bug: #1763337

Depends-on: I322570ae958f8e483b8b2a0ad40d1ee83d084372
Change-Id: I3b59abc839ec6c709e5fd24652610a5fac58ee57
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

custom_env_files and t-h-t UndercloudNetConfigOverride.

Instack templated j2 tags are allowed to be used as well,
which smooths upgrading paths from instack. Known instack_env
to heat params or config opts mappings provide the context for
legacy instack templates processing.

Partial-bug: #1763337

Change-Id: I3b59abc839ec6c709e5fd24652610a5fac58ee57
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Wire-in net_config_override

Allow to override network configs and maintain parity
with instack.

net_config_override takes higher data precedence over
custom_env_files and t-h-t UndercloudNetConfigOverride.

Instack templated j2 tags are allowed to be used as well,
which smooths upgrading paths from instack. Known instack_env
to heat params or config opts mappings provide the context for
legacy instack templates processing.

Partial-bug: #1763337

Change-Id: I3b59abc839ec6c709e5fd24652610a5fac58ee57
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix typo in multiple-nics/role.role.j2.yaml

The multiple-nics template has a typo which prevents the
default route on br-ex from appearing in the NIC configs.
This change fixes that typo so the multiple-nics templates
work correctly.

Change-Id: Iecf3c0c70d538a1a904c12717af9c37f5d860758
(cherry picked from commit 7c685406707b8091e5e73f71efbf10d8ff9cddb7)

commit_message:
Add missed options for bash script.

Initial commit missed 'set -euo pipefail', and redirecting
everything to 'tee' causes job to pass, even ceph-upgrade
command failed.

Change-Id: I5816b3874dff0e5035c3e77c220b56509a12812e

commit_message:
Remove use_tripleo_upgrade and add var into fs037.

As part of the upgrades/updates playbook refactor
it has been removed the existence of a 'legacy'
and 'new' upgrades playbook, which was being
controlled by the 'use_tripleo_upgrade' variable
Iaf30244187d27909ab803175843056e0827d0b24.

Also, it's been moved the parameter container_registry_file
from the overcloud update's playbook into its
corresponding fs.

Related-Bug: #1749740

Depends-On: Iaf30244187d27909ab803175843056e0827d0b24
Depends-On: Iec42b574d697f3acfd668636e3dd11217a3ea25e
Change-Id: I27f13b164bb78619f8830b875ec9f04445ce1e26

commit_message:
Get rid of tasks in overcloud updates playbook.

This patch removes all the tasks being executed
inside the playbook used for running overcloud
updates. Most of these removed tasks are being
handled somewhere else (import triploe-upgrade [0],
mainly) so we can simplify the playbook by calling
the tripleo-upgrade role with the required
parameters defined in each fs.

This patch also gets rid of container_registry_file,
which is being moved into the job's fs in [1].

[0] Icc84645a16aa53ca2cb974dbeb52e6474cd98aab
[1] I27f13b164bb78619f8830b875ec9f04445ce1e26

Change-Id: Iec42b574d697f3acfd668636e3dd11217a3ea25e
Related-Bug: #1749740

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 13:36:01.000000000', 'message': 'Support custom sequence of playbooks to run

When reproducing CI job sometimes needs to run a specific set of
playbooks only. Support this by pasing PLAYBOOKS variable in
env_source script.
Usage example:
- one needs to run everything before undercloud installation:
 * PLAYBOOKS="quickstart.yml" ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of
multinode)
 * PLAYBOOKS:-"ovb-setup.yml" ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of
OVB job)
- one needs to deploy everything before overcloud deployment:
 * PLAYBOOKS="quickstart.yml multinode-undercloud.yml multinode-overcloud-prep.yml"
  ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of multinode)
 * PLAYBOOKS="ovb-setup.yml baremetal-full-undercloud.yml baremetal-full-overcloud-prep.yml"
  ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of OVB)
List of used playbooks is in toci_gate_test-oooq.sh script
in tripleo-ci repo:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/tree/toci_gate_test-oooq.sh#n157

Change-Id: I6388c5e20d499a2e6c5e06f23de9851ef53b40a6
'}]
commit_message:
Support custom sequence of playbooks to run

When reproducing CI job sometimes needs to run a specific set of
playbooks only. Support this by pasing PLAYBOOKS variable in
env_source script.
Usage example:
- one needs to run everything before undercloud installation:
 * PLAYBOOKS="quickstart.yml" ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of
multinode)
 * PLAYBOOKS:-"ovb-setup.yml" ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of
OVB job)
- one needs to deploy everything before overcloud deployment:
 * PLAYBOOKS="quickstart.yml multinode-undercloud.yml multinode-overcloud-prep.yml"
  ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of multinode)
 * PLAYBOOKS="ovb-setup.yml baremetal-full-undercloud.yml baremetal-full-overcloud-prep.yml"
  ./reproduce-quickstart.sh (in case of OVB)
List of used playbooks is in toci_gate_test-oooq.sh script
in tripleo-ci repo:
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/tripleo-ci/tree/toci_gate_test-oooq.sh#n157

Change-Id: I6388c5e20d499a2e6c5e06f23de9851ef53b40a6

commit_message:
Set cleanup in undercloud.conf

If it's defined, we should set the value. Otherwise we can't flip the
value from True (The new default) to False.

Change-Id: I13561c3c2f190d9ae62a8ace88e0ddedf414519c
Needed-By: I027a76d2f37a5af5bd0a599783287632298acf3f
Related-Bug: #1761810

commit_message:
logging: fluentd add multi log files on sources

Currently there are some services such as horizon, keystone that
have more than one log file, currently only one files is posible to
read.

This patch adds the posiility of having more than one file for a
service.

Change-Id: Id1d58637967ffb0e9bd0a83c3cbca699432f5378

[{'created': '2018-03-06 19:34:40.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Adding wrapper scripts for neutron agent subprocesses

The neutron agents use subprocesses like dnsmasq and keepalived as part
of their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart.

Change-Id: Icd4c24ac686d957391548a04722266cefc1bce27

'}, {'created': '2018-04-20 18:50:34.000000000', 'message': 'Adding wrapper scripts for neutron agent subprocesses

The neutron agents use subprocesses like dnsmasq and keepalived as part
of their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart.

Also amends docker daemon options to allow including additional unix
domain sockets to bind to the docker daemon. The paths can be mounted by

commit_message:
Adding wrapper scripts for neutron agent subprocesses

The neutron agents use subprocesses like dnsmasq and keepalived as part
of their implementation. Running these "subprocesses" in separate
containers prevent dataplane breakages/unnecessary failover on agent
container restart.

Also amends docker daemon options to allow including additional unix
domain sockets to bind to the docker daemon. The paths can be mounted by
containers that launch containers instead of mounting /run/docker.sock.
This avoids issues if the docker daemon is restarted while the containers
are running.

Related-Bug: #1749209
Change-Id: Icd4c24ac686d957391548a04722266cefc1bce27

commit_message:
Introduce /availability-zone API endpoint

Nova provide API endpoint for end-users to retrieve the
list of availability zone:
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#availability-zones-os-availability-zone.

Zun would like to provide the same.
Related BP: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/zun-availability-zone

Change-Id: I2188c5a3012e0b0692d48e43dea64234a4921564
Closes-bug: #1766395

commit_message:
Fix typo in multiple-nics/role.role.j2.yaml

The multiple-nics template has a typo which prevents the
default route on br-ex from appearing in the NIC configs.
This change fixes that typo so the multiple-nics templates
work correctly.

Change-Id: Iecf3c0c70d538a1a904c12717af9c37f5d860758

commit_message:
Add started_at attribute to container

In Virtual-kubelet, we need to implement a kubelet
driver for Zun, just the same with ACI. Since Pod
will use the sandbox container start time as the
Pod start time, for align with Pod, we need to record
container started_at time field to record this.

Ref: https://github.com/virtual-kubelet/virtual-kubelet/blob/master/providers/azure/aci.go#L744

Part of blueprint golang-client

Change-Id: Iefedcd828b1b2935892bbe46729cdac8963c1d9a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@arm.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-27 13:19:58.000000000', 'message': "Make test_detail_quota() test more generic

Backends such as OVN will create a port to be used by the metadata agent
upon creating a network. That port will be substract from the tenant's
quota and that was what was previsouly causing this test to fail in OVN.

This patch is changing the approach to make it more generic by calculating
the number of used ports based on the number existent after the network
is created and prior to the new port being created.

A similar approach was used in the commit
92a6663b1568b6216ebf6112803a3294b100dd4c for the same reason.

Change-Id: I952d31c4473159a3fdd0552eeae98750ee27a1f9

Change-Id: I952d31c4473159a3fdd0552eeae98750ee27a1f9

commit_message:
Make test_detail_quota() test more generic

Backends such as OVN will create a port to be used by the metadata agent
upon creating a network. That port will be substract from the tenant's
quota and that was what was previsouly causing this test to fail in OVN.

This patch is changing the approach to make it more generic by calculating
the number of used ports based on the number existent after the network
is created and prior to the new port being created.

A similar approach was used in the patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/559758/ for the same reason.

Change-Id: I952d31c4473159a3fdd0552eeae98750ee27a1f9

[{'created': '2018-04-28 00:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add a debug env for unit tests

Debugging unit tests locally with pdb ends in failure with tox.
this patch adds debug environment to debug tests with pdb
break points by following below steps.

1. set break point in code by adding import pdb;pdb.set_trace
2. run tox -e debug test_regex

Change-Id: I088a558a1fb68b3bc2a218ccda0911ed1389f91f
'}]
commit_message:
Add a debug env for unit tests

Debugging unit tests locally with pdb ends in failure with tox.
this patch adds debug environment to debug tests with pdb
break points by following below steps.

1. set break point in code by adding import pdb;pdb.set_trace
2. run tox -e debug test_regex

commit_message:
Update s3api configuration

Swift has now merged the swift3 middleware into its own
source tree and renamed it to s3api.

Use of auth_host, auth_port and auth_protocol
configuration options was deprecated in the Newton release
in favor of auth_uri

Related-Change-Id: I9c61d48e673d513cb4c5cf0c9f8b7d1b894729eb
Change-Id: I7f085b0c05f2b8c50e7f94ca1c7f4670660da688
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix app.wsgi path in Debian

Debian is using /usr/lib/python3, not /usr/lib/python2.7. This patch
fixes that problem.

Change-Id: I14f8a29b085a5ae8b1d0456739cece110a3d9853

Added flake8-import-order to test-requirements.txt to avoid
an "unknown option 'import-order-style' ignored" warning.

Removed {posargs} from flake8 invocation so it can be called
such as 'tox -e pep8 HEAD~1' in order to only run on files
changed in the top commit.

commit_message:
Fix some pep8 errors, update tox.ini

Fixed E731, W503 and I201 pep8 errors.

Added flake8-import-order to test-requirements.txt to avoid
an "unknown option 'import-order-style' ignored" warning.

Removed {posargs} from flake8 invocation so it can be called
such as 'tox -e pep8 HEAD~1' in order to only run on files
changed in the top commit.

Removed py34, py27 and pypy from the tox.ini envlist since
there are no unit tests, and tox reports it skipped all tests.

Change-Id: I574cafe074befa59aaee44b092b011e27f5f4211

commit_message:
[Docs] Add guide on how to do advanced gate job debugging

This patch adds additional information on how to do advanced
debugging of failing gate jobs directly on test nodes.

Change-Id: I97c93ecfa77b13e5ebcff906219ab8002e266b13

subject: Cleanups for LOSF RPC server
messages:
[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-04 23:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-05 00:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Note to anyone wanting to play with this: I've got a branch in the vagrant-swift-all-in-one project that installs the various dependencies needed by the Golang stuff.

https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/losf

Make sure to check out the "losf" branch, as the stuff I'm talking about isn't on master.

You'll still need to run `go get` for the RPC server, but all the other dependencies should be taken care of. Oh, and you'll need to have a properly configured GOPATH environment variable on your host OS. (This can be as simple as `mkdir ~/go; export GOPATH=$HOME/go`)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 23:40:12.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanups for LOSF RPC server

Other than running everything through `goimports` (which my editor
does upon save), there are only two actual changes:

The protobuf stuff is now imported as
"github.com/openstack/swift/go/losf-rpc/proto" instead of
"github.com/openstack/losf-rpc/proto" so the structure of $GOPATH
looks like the repo structure. If we don't do this, I get confused,
and it seems weird for Swift to claim anything besides "swift" under
"openstack".

Also tweaked the statsd import lines a bit; the compiler couldn't find
package "statsd" when imported without the alias. Maybe newer Go
compilers are better at this; I've got 1.10.1 (whatever patch level
ships with Ubuntu 18.04).

Change-Id: Ib24ee00113750e156733075e7971541f417d958e
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanups for LOSF RPC server

Other than running everything through `goimports` (which my editor
does upon save), there are only two actual changes:

The protobuf stuff is now imported as
"github.com/openstack/swift/go/losf-rpc/proto" instead of
"github.com/openstack/losf-rpc/proto" so the structure of $GOPATH
looks like the repo structure. If we don't do this, I get confused,
and it seems weird for Swift to claim anything besides "swift" under
"openstack".

Also tweaked the statsd import lines a bit; the compiler couldn't find
package "statsd" when imported without the alias. Maybe newer Go
compilers are better at this; I've got 1.10.1 (whatever patch level
ships with Ubuntu 18.04).

Change-Id: Ib24ee00113750e156733075e7971541f417d958e

commit_message:
Implement LocalContainerRegistry parameter

LocalContainerRegistry is a new parameter that is set to local_ip by
default. It'll be used in TripleO Heat Templates when deploying a local
container registry, to bind the service on this address.

Before, it was done in instack-undercloud and automatically binded on
local-ip. Now, it'll be a parameter and still defaulted to the local-ip
used on the undercloud.

It's part of the efforts to containerize the undercloud and deploy
Docker with Ansible.

Change-Id: Iab2615f9be9e107d85d509f75bbfee01fe04b88a

[{'created': '2018-05-03 09:50:46.000000000', 'message': "Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Partial-Bug: #1764470
"}]
commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: Ic03405a6f07ca16201cc1e35aea2cde2f298d4cd
Partial-Bug: #1764470

> The idea is good and needed . But CRUD actions for objects are
 > usually in api test directory. In scenario we usually have a  whole
 > LB tree with manipulation and LB testing . This comment is relevant
 > for all in https://review.openstack.org/#/q/owner:%22Jude+Cross%22+status:open.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 21:09:30.000000000', 'message': "Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139
(cherry picked from commit 80a001989351d3d427c204c8c06cfacc964f2a35)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139
(cherry picked from commit 80a001989351d3d427c204c8c06cfacc964f2a35)

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: If8e078e69ce74b4da020702c8ed790dd2318d155

commit_message:
Update the tripleo-ci doc, point to latest doc

Point people at the latest tripleo doc for
details on how to recreate or add a new job.
Point to tripleo-quickstart doc for details about
the tools used.

Enabling CI jobs on doc, will be reverted.

Change-Id: I7f8fe1f696cc6eeefde3c006c7638ea3e04fa0f7

commit_message:
Add --stack to update, upgrade and ffwd-upgrade 'run' CLI.

We need to be able to define the stack name if it
is different than 'overcloud', for the ansible inventory
used with the upgrade playbooks.

Change-Id: I0499eabc5c6f15cb32b2471c86245578c71a2a60
Closes-Bug: 1767379

commit_message:
Use identity version v2.0 for Pike

* By default in stackrc, the Identity version is 3 but pike does not
  have full v3 support, It leads to failing the tempest tests.
* The above patch fix it.

Change-Id: Iaf0a82c3408c9dcda0c17efb220480e9c0bfdcb9

[{'created': '2018-04-25 13:52:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix net_config_override validations

There is an issue with the _validate_no_ip_change function
where it doesn't work correctly with a custom net_config_override
file.

This patch resolves validation issue so that custom os-net-config
templates are taken into account. Additionally it makes it so
that the net_config_override can be empty, thus providing the
user a means of disabling os-net-config if they choose to do so.

Change-Id: I127c2742522e695dd1fd15413a47bf4d8ebea8fa
Related-bug: #1764507
"}, {'created': '2018-05-02 08:06:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix net_config_override validations

where it doesn't work correctly with a custom net_config_override
file.

This patch resolves validation issue so that custom os-net-config
templates are taken into account. Additionally it makes it so
that the net_config_override can be empty, thus providing the
user a means of disabling os-net-config if they choose to do so.

Change-Id: I127c2742522e695dd1fd15413a47bf4d8ebea8fa
Related-bug: #1764507
"}]
commit_message:
Fix net_config_override validations

There is an issue with the _validate_no_ip_change function
where it doesn't work correctly with a custom net_config_override
file.

This patch resolves validation issue so that custom os-net-config
templates are taken into account. Additionally it makes it so
that the net_config_override can be empty, thus providing the
user a means of disabling os-net-config if they choose to do so.

Change-Id: I127c2742522e695dd1fd15413a47bf4d8ebea8fa
Related-bug: #1764507

commit_message:
use --force-reinstall for tqe

If bootstrap is called twice the requirements in
quickstart-extras-requirements will not be reinstalled.
replacing no-cache-dir w/ force-reinstall ensures the
latest tqe and other requirements are installed.

commit_message:
Remove tasks from overcloud upgrade playbook.

Remove the tasks being executed inside the playbook used
for running overcloud upgrades. Most of these task are
being handled somewhere else (import tripleo-upgrade [0],
mainly) so we can simplify the playbook by importing the
tripleo-upgrade role with the required parameters defined
in each fs.

[0] Icc84645a16aa53ca2cb974dbeb52e6474cd98aab

Related-Bug: #1749740
Change-Id: Iaf30244187d27909ab803175843056e0827d0b24

commit_message:
Allowing Non-IP Traffic in L2 and L3 domains

Non-IP traffic is allowed in L2 and L3 Domains
The default_allow_non_ip setting determines if non-ip traffic is
allowed in Nuage specific L2 and L3 domains.

Change-Id: Ia0a04e3f7893600d5a709b4b8594187e5bc67e9d
(cherry picked from commit f7fb48470d3efcc338ff907be3b66d297a589f1a)

commit_message:
Fix hieradata overrides for UC instack/heat install

Complement Idf595498e46eeb88acfd4c3a21094d22197a6d7b
and make sure heat installer takes a valid hieradata
override file depending on config vars setup.

Update README as well to explain the cases better.

Closes-bug: #1766579
Closes-bug: #1766848

Change-Id: Id821f613fe72e2f768f80acaa5657a8be86879b7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove step_config from CinderVolume backend services

Cinder backends should not repeat the step_config that the CinderVolume
service uses to trigger things in puppet-tripleo. This is benign when
Cinder runs on baremetal, but causes problems when Cinder runs in
containers. It causes the cinder-volume service to run twice, in both
the container as well as on the baremetal host.

Closes-Bug: #1768063
Change-Id: Ie02553f74563883094a13c67a958b15371e90424
(cherry picked from commit 94b5c1155e7b8ccd54f0e17e8fb07f5a7a378aea)

'}, {'created': '2018-04-13 09:07:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix automatic subnet CIDR generation

This helps generating subnet masks by checking for
subnet masks already used from the same test class.

This also avoid having to check if a subnet with
conflicting subnet CIDR already exists treating
subnet error creation by looking in a local set
of already reserver CIDRs

It fixes a problem that makes that create_subnet
tryies to reuse the same CIDRs more than once
producing test failures.

It also allows methods to blank list some CIDRs
to avoid create_subnet from using it an therefore
avoid interferences.

Change-Id: I73e08a6832777d972990c3e68c582ef61568ad4e
'}, {'created': '2018-04-13 09:11:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix automatic subnet CIDR generation

This helps generating subnet masks by checking for
subnet masks already used from the same test class.

This also avoid having to check if a subnet with
conflicting subnet CIDR already exists treating
subnet error creation by looking in a local set
of already reserver CIDRs

It fixes a problem that makes that create_subnet
tryies to reuse the same CIDRs more than once
producing test failures.

It also allows methods to blank list some CIDRs

commit_message:
Fix automatic subnet CIDR generation

This helps generating subnet masks by checking for
subnet masks already used from the same test class.

This also avoids having to check if a subnet with
conflicting subnet CIDR already exists treating
subnet error creation by looking in a local set
of already reserved CIDRs.

It fixes a problem that makes create_subnet
try to reuse the same CIDRs more than once
producing test failures.

It also allows methods to blank list some CIDRs
to avoid create_subnet from using it an therefore
avoid interferences.

Change-Id: I73e08a6832777d972990c3e68c582ef61568ad4e

commit_message:
Add documentation for callback priority

As [1]. introduced priorties for execution of callbacks,
this patch adds some information about priority group
that can be used to maintain for order of callback executions
for different events of a resource.

1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541766

Change-Id: I2da39c4f895e25924de46e8eca85e1cc67c4d0f3
