[{'created': '2018-05-04 07:57:20.000000000', 'message': "No syslog user in Debian

manifests/swift.pp attemps to create /var/log/swift using the syslog user
in Debian, but this user doesn't exist in this OS (it only exists in
Ubuntu). This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: I2ef53b6f5865eb0d42834d9c4580caea530d54c1
"}]
commit_message:
No syslog user in Debian

manifests/swift.pp attemps to create /var/log/swift using the syslog user
in Debian, but this user doesn't exist in this OS (it only exists in
Ubuntu). This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: I2ef53b6f5865eb0d42834d9c4580caea530d54c1

commit_message:
Debian: add puppet system user

To avoid error messages like this:
Unable to set ownership to puppet:puppet for log file:
/home/zuul/workspace/puppet.log

we're adding the puppet user before running ./run_tests.sh

Change-Id: I0a00a7f41e700a3e503c1b98947803af47230678

commit_message:
Revert "Update the cirros version to "0.4.0""

We are reverting to 0.3.5 in order to use the upstream image
cache, also, devstack tests with 0.3.5 so it would be good to
stay consistent.

We can go back to 0.4.0 once devstack uses it and this will
avoid us having to pull down the image with every job.

This reverts commit 58566a032b3b4c9a95cf50e883b1ce98ad0b503b.

Change-Id: If7f1542d6e9954b15024fa8074fd9938f7eb204b

It is not robust to upload a special package in a common method.

oozie/sharelib to let oozie work.
This patch removes the uploading step in sahara because there is

So when we build the oozie binary package, "commons-httpclient"
will be as a part of it.

(cherry picked from commit 7553ae8fc827d9bf84956f61750b87409d0f7bfe)

commit_message:
Remove step upload package to oozie/sharelib

It is not robust to upload a special package in a common method.
However, because of change from Hadoop(2.8.2 and later)side,
we do need the dependency package "commons-httpclient" in
oozie/sharelib to let oozie work.
This patch removes the uploading step in sahara because there is
a patch 2eedcec728b4f93e4cb226c5137159dcb3ddbfa3 which add
"commons-httpclient" as a dependency to oozie/sharelib.
So when we build the oozie binary package, "commons-httpclient"
will be as a part of it.

Change-Id: I4f20a356efc2dcc51aac2f10105be6aa351f87e8
(cherry picked from commit 7553ae8fc827d9bf84956f61750b87409d0f7bfe)

commit_message:
Use openstack.config directly for config

shade depends on openstacksdk already. Let's go ahead and start
consuming it directly rather than through the os-client-config compat
layer. We have to leave the os-client-config depend for the legacy
client functions.

Change-Id: Ibe2176c16e29960e9cc2b569325e41d1a4e297a8

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-05-04 12:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-05-04 15:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 12:04:56.000000000', 'message': "Add logging to capabilities filter

The capabilities filter gets incorrectly blamed for a lot of
deployment failures because on a retry of a node deployment the
filter has to fail because there is only one node that can match
when using predictable placement.  However, we don't have any
logging to help determine why the filter fails.  This adds logging
to explain why nodes fell through, which will hopefully help with
debugging these problems.

Change-Id: I702209e9b5a1e546bf8cb784eec8bdc3c97c63eb
Closes-Bug: 1718502
(cherry picked from commit e5d16155364c1dae2db238506f236194e2dfb1dc)
"}]
commit_message:
Add logging to capabilities filter

The capabilities filter gets incorrectly blamed for a lot of
deployment failures because on a retry of a node deployment the
filter has to fail because there is only one node that can match
when using predictable placement.  However, we don't have any
logging to help determine why the filter fails.  This adds logging
to explain why nodes fell through, which will hopefully help with
debugging these problems.

Change-Id: I702209e9b5a1e546bf8cb784eec8bdc3c97c63eb
Closes-Bug: 1718502
(cherry picked from commit e5d16155364c1dae2db238506f236194e2dfb1dc)

So this now creates the -messages container, and I see files written, but my deploy failed, and the status still says SUCCESS?

Stack openshift CREATE_FAILED 

openshift.OpenShiftWorker.0.OpenShiftWorker:
  resource_type: OS::TripleO::OpenShiftWorkerServer
  physical_resource_id: 56071a86-a99b-45d3-a59a-7544d4c224d8
  status: CREATE_FAILED
  status_reason: |
    ResourceInError: resources.OpenShiftWorker: Went to status ERROR due to "Message: Build of instance 56071a86-a99b-45d3-a59a-7544d4c224d8 aborted: Failure prepping block device., Code: 500"
Heat Stack create failed.
Heat Stack create failed.


(undercloud) [stack@undercloud d6a30cfa-c080-4ad9-90d4-95a8d76b7e93]$ tail latest.yaml 
          message: <% task(run_validations).result %>
          status: FAILED
        type: direct
        version: '2.0'
    version: '2.0'
  updated_at: '2018-03-16 12:20:49'
message: ''
payload: {}
status: SUCCESS
type: tripleo.deployment.v1.deploy_plan

So we're missing handling of the error path here I think?

Also I wonder, why do we need to include the entire execution in the output?  It seems unrelated to the status, as it just duplicates the workflow definition?

Also I'm unclear about the usage of the "all" directory, it seems to duplicate the uuid per-execution one?

Finally I think the "latest" link/copy needs to live at the top-level, as with this you still need to find it amongst possibly several worklfows in the container, and we won't clean old "latest" so we'll end up with duplicates?

I did wonder if we can use swift symlinks instead of a copy for this:

https://developer.rackspace.com/blog/simulate-symLinks-on-cloud-files/'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-16 12:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-16 12:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-16 12:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

> [snip]
 > So we're missing handling of the error path here I think?

Interesting. I'm not sure why that would be happening. I'll try and do some more testing.

 > 
 > Also I wonder, why do we need to include the entire execution in
 > the output?  It seems unrelated to the status, as it just
 > duplicates the workflow definition?

No, probably not. I changed it to the ID only. I originally included the full execution as that was what we send in the zaqar message - but I think we want to move to the ID only eventually.

 > Also I'm unclear about the usage of the "all" directory, it seems
 > to duplicate the uuid per-execution one?

I made an error in the description before, so maybe it is clearer now? The idea was that you could access every message for a workflow, regardless of the execution id - what if you don't know the execution id?

I don't want to keep all three locations for the message in swift - hopefully jtomasek can tell us which is most useful and what we should keep/change.

 
 > Finally I think the "latest" link/copy needs to live at the
 > top-level, as with this you still need to find it amongst possibly
 > several worklfows in the container, and we won't clean old "latest"
 > so we'll end up with duplicates?

I moved it to the type top level. So it will be the latest per-workflow, I think that might be the most useful place. Otherwise you will get a general latest message but it will be unclear what for - until you download it and see the type? I assume if you want to get the latest message then you know which workflow you care about.

 > 
 > I did wonder if we can use swift symlinks instead of a copy for
 > this:
 > 
 > https://developer.rackspace.com/blog/simulate-symLinks-on-cloud-files/

Good idea! I'll look into doing this, perhaps as a follow up - but I'll see what I can do.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-16 13:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

>  Otherwise you will get a general latest message but it will be unclear what for - until you download it and see the type?

I think the issue is with per-workflow latest, you still don't have an easy way to know which workflow is the most recently updated, therefore which has the definitive "plan status".

I'm imagining something like this:

(undercloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ openstack overcloud plan list
+-----------+
| Plan Name | Status
+-----------+
| openshift | SUCCESS (tripleo.deployment.v1.deploy_plan)

We need some easy way to poll the status, and just get the most recently updated workflow status I think?'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-19 10:56:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Code-Review+2

I think this is good for a first-pass now, thanks!

We do have the issue that because the deploy workflows are asynchronous, you get the following when a heat stack fails on deploy:
message: ''
payload: {}
status: SUCCESS
type: tripleo.deployment.v1.deploy_plan

So from the UI point of view this is not yet enough to actually discover the status of the deployed plan, but we can iterate on that in subsequent patches.

Also I think we probably need to ensure more verbose messages (e.g including on SUCCESS, as above the empty string isn't providing much useful context we can show to the user about which part of the deploy workflow we had success at."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-19 17:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-03-19 18:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-20 19:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-21 09:25:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-21 09:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Patch Set 24 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-03-23 15:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 7509, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

As mentioned In comment on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554224/4, I don't think that persisting messages is what will help us tracking the state of things. What we IMHO want is to store the newly required state in DB (Swift) and let workflows operate on that state.

I really like the messages handling part of this patch. Persisting messages IMHO won't help clients with determining the state and makes the workflow execution less performant due to unnecessary swift calls."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

> I really like the messages handling part of this patch. Persisting messages IMHO won't help clients with determining the state and makes the workflow execution less performant due to unnecessary swift calls.

Can you expand on this a bit?  Like give an example of the sort of data structure you want to read from swift, and how it differs from a persisted message?

When we discussed this previously I was (perhaps mistakenly) under the impression that getting a "latest" message from a predictable location in this container would amount to the same as what you are asking for, but perhaps I'm missing something?

The disadvantage of inventing a new abstraction vs messages is we have to update every workflow to write the plan deploy status and still send messages - this abstraction combines them both, with the idea that it would be *more* performant and less impactful on the various workflows (although I do understand we'll need to start sending an in-progress message that will also be persisted to swift to derive that state transition which is currently missing).'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-03-28 11:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

(1 comment)

I'm working on an update to this but added some comments - I think we can probably remove the "all" path and just make the per-workflow files more easily sortable?'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-03-28 11:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

commit_message:
Standardise Workflow messaging and optionally persist messages

This workflow captures the boilerplate that is copied and pasted for Zaqar
messages. It also adds the ability to persist the messages in Swift.

This can be manually tested with:

    $ cat input.json
    {
        "type": "test",
        "queue_name": "tripleo",
        "plan_name": "overcloud",
        "execution": {
            "id": "UUID"
        }
    }
    $ openstack workflow execution create tripleo.messaging.v1.send input.json

Co-Authored-By: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1757372
Implements: blueprint config-download-workflows
Depends-On: I78b4fc7673a4039ed7ef32b16bb2850411f7fcc6
Change-Id: Ib854689a3e606f18db7354427918fa8043ac28e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-28 15:29:54.000000000', 'message': "Update all SHAs for 17.0.4

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.4

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I096205dfc581760817d96ef7e8664480d166d17b
Change-Id: Ie2f63c8a84cc5d6f5d1b6803384862bae8e96419

subject: Fix container create command parameter error
messages:
[{'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-04-19 02:51:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So this patch basically changes the command from

  $ zun create cirros sleep 10

to

  $ zun create --command "sleep" --command "10" cirros

@chenyb4, is it correct? All, let me know what is your opinion on this proposal.'}, {'account_id': 23517, 'date': '2018-04-19 03:02:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Hongbin Lu
That's a good idea. I think so."}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-04-27 09:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> So this patch basically changes the command from
 > 
 > $ zun create cirros sleep 10
 > 
 > to
 > 
 > $ zun create --command "sleep" --command "10" cirros
 > 
 > @chenyb4, is it correct? All, let me know what is your opinion on
 > this proposal.

I don't think the new proposal is friendly. For a long command, it will be weird to use --command multiple times.'}, {'account_id': 25571, 'date': '2018-05-04 19:23:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Agree with @Madhuri, this command structure won't look good."}]

commit_message:
Fix container create command parameter error

This patch Change create container parameter, Change
value ('command': u'"uptime" "--name" "c001" "-m" "32"',)
to ('command': u'"uptime", "--name": "c001", "-m": "32",),
and change 'command' to '--command'.

Closes-Bug: #1764990

Change-Id: I4fff0d462be3a4382dfbc31305c47610de17607c
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
exclude cmd2 0.8.3 and update to 0.8.4

Release 0.8.3 of cmd2 failed to properly specify a new dependency so
installing it breaks interactive mode for OSC and other cliff-based
apps. 0.8.4 fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I8bbd749e3328596fd333bd7f58391b9d688c00cf
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/560120
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[DellEMC]Update Manila VNX driver

This patch adds following 3 options:

* network_plugin_ipv6_enabled
* emc_ssl_cert_verify
* emc_ssl_cert_path

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555648

Change-Id: I42b0555c077dbc9f9d5ae4efaf1ec41a9c563b6a

commit_message:
Add Ceph upgrade tasks

Ceph upgrade is done with dedicated command.
This change adds tasks to create ceph upgrade scripts and
perform actual ceph upgrade.
Ceph upgrade would be run just in case ceph_osd service is present
in the list stack's enabled services

Change-Id: I67ade3ffc06ea839cf05ce42c4421d2a850570a3
(cherry picked from commit 23ee1030573649ac7a5b80bdc931470687855dbb)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 10:48:30.000000000', 'message': 'Instance HA: prevent compute to start on a host being evacuated

When the evacuation of a nova-compute is in progress on a compute node,
starting the nova-compute service on that node would cause a race in
setting task_state [1] and could ultimately lead failures with all
future evacuation attempts on the compute node.

To avoid triggering that situation, introduce a startup wrapper when
Instance HA is enabled. The wrapper loops until the force-down flag is
clear and all evacuation finished, and then starts nova_compute.

[1] If71727cde51c29231dbb9a51c5babbcdfc802bdd

Partial-Bug: #1764883
Co-Authored-By: Andrew Beekhof <abeekhof@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id1fc820b42fb72fc861fda82b04f6a3fa2b6b6f6
(cherry picked from commit 9602a9bafc0d6b724aa4228411a8475e23f94efb)
'}]
commit_message:
Instance HA: prevent compute to start on a host being evacuated

When the evacuation of a nova-compute is in progress on a compute node,
starting the nova-compute service on that node would cause a race in
setting task_state [1] and could ultimately lead failures with all
future evacuation attempts on the compute node.

To avoid triggering that situation, introduce a startup wrapper when
Instance HA is enabled. The wrapper loops until the force-down flag is
clear and all evacuation finished, and then starts nova_compute.

[1] If71727cde51c29231dbb9a51c5babbcdfc802bdd

Partial-Bug: #1764883
Co-Authored-By: Andrew Beekhof <abeekhof@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id1fc820b42fb72fc861fda82b04f6a3fa2b6b6f6
(cherry picked from commit 9602a9bafc0d6b724aa4228411a8475e23f94efb)

commit_message:
Containerize Neutron LBaaS service plugin

In Rocky, environment files in environments/services directory defaulted
to containerized deployments and the baremetal ones were moved to
environments/services-baremetal. This backport patch moves environment
files back so that they can be compatible with Queens.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563214/

Change-Id: I68e5ca5a78a2bd08082a494b636c6e2debb6bbae
(cherry picked from commit 9526cef547278a53c237f08c5b5e79948fc031dd)

commit_message:
heat: align config with instack-undercloud

- Enable heat convergence for containerized undercloud
- Set max_json_body_size=4194304 for containerized undercloud.
- Introduce HeatMaxNestedStackDepth parameter.
- Introduce HeatReauthenticationAuthMethod parameter and configure it to
  'trusts' for the undercloud.

Change-Id: I044bf29e7ae320a478e0ba0eb12870f47735d4f1

In a converged architecture with storage and compute on the same
host, UFW can get in the way of tunneled traffic interpreting it as
INVALID. UFW makes solving this more difficult than it needs to be.

commit_message:
Allow GRE traffic in converged architecture

In a converged architecture with storage and compute on the same
host, UFW can get in the way of tunneled traffic interpreting it as
INVALID. UFW makes solving this more difficult than it needs to be.
See http://northernmost.org/blog/gre-tunnels-and-ufw/index.html for
context.

This change updates /etc/ufw/before.rules to add GRE as an allowed
input.

Also, guarantee ufw is installed for LP #1763716

Please review and merge charm-helpers first:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/170

Change-Id: I789854c33e3af12f7412633dbf7c921beb0ed2b5
Closes-Bug: #1757564
Closes-Bug: #1763716

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

commit_message:
Octavia amphora image handling updates

This patch changes some defaults that turned out to be not very good in
practice to be empty values. The default behavior is instead
distribution specific behavior in the ansible playbooks.

Change-Id: Ib5338d0fadc9c1c8fcf73c53e4364d35a5f29fe7
Related-Bug: #1754039
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562019/

subject: Allow GRE traffic in converged architecture
messages:
[{'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-01 18:31:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-05-01 20:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-05-02 07:10:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

lgtm, couple of minor nits.'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:58:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Ok i've thought about this a bit more now and tbh I think we really need to ensure persistence so that if somebody disables and re-enables ufw they will still have this rule. Therefore I think we need to simply add '-A ufw-before-input -p gre -j ACCEPT' as the first rule in /etc/ufw/before.rules."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-05-02 11:59:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-02 14:35:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-02 14:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

WIP'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-02 16:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Still WIP'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-02 23:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-02 23:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-05-03 07:36:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Current before.rules is not working for me (see comment).

I also have a concern that if we use the approach of just overwriting the file we run the risk of losing any updates that UFW might apply in the future e.g. from CVEs. It wouldn't be too hard to inject a line into the existing file so I reckon that's a better option that straight overwrite."}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2018-05-03 09:04:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ive proposed an alternative patch at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566001/'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2018-05-04 17:57:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by another PR.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 18:31:54.000000000', 'message': 'Allow GRE traffic in converged architecture

In a converged architecture with storage and compute on the same
host, UFW can get in the way of tunneled traffic interpreting it as
INVALID.  UFW makes solving this more difficult than it needs to be.
See [0] for context.

This change calls iptables directly to allow GRE traffic. By using
the UFW target, ufw-before-input, UFW will clean up after itself,
including the manually inserted rule, if UFW is disabled.

Also, guarantee ufw is installed for Bug#1763716.

[0] http://northernmost.org/blog/gre-tunnels-and-ufw/index.html

Closes-Bug: #1757564
Closes-Bug: #1763716

Change-Id: I8d2310119eb20f39959cfce1360ceebe1264df60

commit_message:
Allow GRE traffic in converged architecture

In a converged architecture with storage and compute on the same
host, UFW can get in the way of tunneled traffic interpreting it as
INVALID.  UFW makes solving this more difficult than it needs to be.
See http://northernmost.org/blog/gre-tunnels-and-ufw/index.html for
context.

This change updates /etc/ufw/before.rules to add GRE as an allowed
input.

Also, guarantee ufw is installed for Bug#1763716.

Please review and merge charm-helpers first:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/170

Closes-Bug: #1757564
Closes-Bug: #1763716

Change-Id: I8d2310119eb20f39959cfce1360ceebe1264df60

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 22:23:03.000000000', 'message': 'process groups individually and merge candidates

Prepares for the granular request group merge candidates work by
creating an AllocationCandidates._get_by_single_request_group() method
that solves for a single request group. The index of the request group
is now passed along with the MatchSpec. A placeholder
_merge_candidates() method is supplied along with the docstring from the
granular request groups patch.

Change-Id: I05f2737730c45377d42e1e6f1a2364d51215b181
blueprint: granular-request-groups
'}]
commit_message:
process groups individually and merge candidates

Prepares for the granular request group merge candidates work by
creating an AllocationCandidates._get_by_single_request_group() method
that solves for a single request group. The index of the request group
is now passed along with the MatchSpec. A placeholder
_merge_candidates() method is supplied along with the docstring from the
granular request groups patch.

Change-Id: I05f2737730c45377d42e1e6f1a2364d51215b181
blueprint: granular-request-groups

snmp: ignore rfc1905.NoSuchInstance result

If the SNMP polling return such a value, it should be ignored.

Change-Id: I275f43f8800d9477fedd100db68b48c93e7ad75d

commit_message:
Install os-testr

With tempest transitioning from testrepository to stestr, tempest no
longer depends on os-testr.  This results in subunit2html not getting
installed which means the task `Generate html subunit results` does not
generate any HTML output.

Change-Id: Ic84d6d1cbba27dcf2c8ab0aac4ac07596ece0aeb
(cherry picked from commit b19f6d7057c8ee413b89cc100ef83809111d97ba)

commit_message:
Update layout docs for running console proxies

As of Rocky, the cell databases are being used for storing console
authorizations, so the layout for running console proxies has
changed from global to a deployment to per cell.

Part of blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: If5c7b081682f0cb36a678d0e21e26b7985cd8527

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 21:13:19.000000000', 'message': 'add logging properties

Change-Id: Id555132199f268b21aaa939a84760c744238dd2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-02 21:19:12.000000000', 'message': 'Correct cluster properties

When running a multi-node ELK stack (5+ nodes) the elasticsearch server
needs to be able to mark and identify nodes that will be data and master
nodes. This change ensures that the first set of available master nodes
is mark accordingly as both data and master and that all other nodes are
marked as cluster members with alternating nodes being marked as data
nodes. With this change the cluster will be able to grow as well as
handle large data sets more efficiently.

This change ensures that sharding is correctly started when the cluster
is deployed and that the beat services are using the recommended
sharding practices.

Change-Id: Id555132199f268b21aaa939a84760c744238dd2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-02 22:02:51.000000000', 'message': 'Correct cluster properties

needs to be able to mark and identify nodes that will be data and master
nodes. This change ensures that the first set of available master nodes
is mark accordingly as both data and master and that all other nodes are
marked as cluster members with alternating nodes being marked as data
nodes. With this change the cluster will be able to grow as well as
handle large data sets more efficiently.

This change ensures that sharding is correctly started when the cluster
is deployed and that the beat services are using the recommended
sharding practices.

Change-Id: Id555132199f268b21aaa939a84760c744238dd2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-05-02 22:26:00.000000000', 'message': 'Correct cluster properties

marked as cluster members with alternating nodes being marked as data
nodes. With this change the cluster will be able to grow as well as
handle large data sets more efficiently.

This change ensures that sharding is correctly started when the cluster
is deployed and that the beat services are using the recommended
sharding practices.

Change-Id: Id555132199f268b21aaa939a84760c744238dd2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Correct cluster properties

When running a multi-node ELK stack (5+ nodes) the elasticsearch server
needs to be able to mark and identify nodes that will be data and master
nodes. This change ensures that the first set of available master nodes
is mark accordingly as both data and master and that all other nodes are
marked as cluster members with alternating nodes being marked as data
nodes. With this change the cluster will be able to grow as well as
handle large data sets more efficiently.

This change ensures that sharding is correctly started when the cluster
is deployed and that the beat services are using the recommended
sharding practices.

Change-Id: Id555132199f268b21aaa939a84760c744238dd2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

(2 comments)

The Glance PTL has asked us to -2 trivial changes to reduce pressure on the gates until the stable branch for newton is cut.

In the meantime, there are a few things you could do with this patch.

(1) The problem you've identified could be handled as a bugfix to the doc tools (see my comment on PS2--there's already a bug filed for this, maybe you could tackle fixing it?).

(2) I tried a workaround, but I think the workaround shows that the api-ref tool probably has a bug handling unicode in headings.  You might want to test that out and file a bug (and fix it if you're motivated!).

(3) "List all images" isn't quite accurate as a title for this call.  But if neither of the bugs above are fixed soon, I'd prefer that your patch change the v2 api-ref to have "List images" for this call, and change the v1 api-ref (which will be deprecated in Newton) to have either "Show images" or "List all images".  That way the "compromise" language will be on the api-ref least likely to be used, instead of on the api-ref for the current version.'}, {'account_id': 20079, 'date': '2016-08-26 07:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
[api-ref] "Show images" should be changed to "List images"

"List images" had been taken by the v1 API, but now that its
api reference has been removed, that's no longer a problem.
Can also remove the superfluous "an"s that were used in the
v2 titles to prevent sphinx conflicts.

Co-authored-by: Ha Van Tu <tuhv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2c1ce3f5c1279a93a08855c554e156c4fc115f61

After discussion with alaski on IRC it seems that there is no existing way to know if the proxy is deployed inside a cell or at the api cell level. revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-24 16:47:44.000000000', 'message': 'Convert websocketproxy to use db for token validation

Now we have new style console URLs with instance uuids
we can use the ConsoleConnection object to do token
validation. This change converts websocketproxy to use
consoleauth for URLs that have no instance uuid (generated
by compute managers that have not been upgraded) and
the ConsoleConnection object for URLs that do have an
instance uuid.

Tha ConsoleConnection object is prepared to work with cells
v2. If cells v1 is enabled we consoleauth. Still looking at
how to avoid doing that.

Change-Id: If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4
partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

'}, {'created': '2017-07-07 16:56:26.000000000', 'message': 'Convert websocketproxy to use db for token validation

Now we can use the ConsoleConnection object to do token
validation. This change converts websocketproxy to use
the ConsoleConnection object for token validation.

Tha ConsoleConnection object is prepared to work with cells
v2. We use consoleauth if using cells v1.

A new config option: [workarounds]/enable_consoleauth has been
added to aid in transitioning to the database backend if
resetting already existing consoles would be problematic for an
operator.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4

commit_message:
Convert websocketproxy to use db for token validation

Now we can use the ConsoleAuthToken object to do token
validation. This change converts websocketproxy to use
the ConsoleAuthToken object for token validation.

Tha ConsoleAuthToken object is prepared to work with cells
v2. We use consoleauth if using cells v1.

A new config option: [workarounds]/enable_consoleauth has been
added to aid in transitioning to the database backend if
resetting already existing consoles would be problematic for an
operator.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Depends-On: I67894a31b887a93de26f3d2d8a1fa84be5b9ea89

Change-Id: If1b6e5f20d2ea82d94f5f0550f13189fc9bc16c4

commit_message:
Update lxc_host/pip_install role SHA's

This enables the fix for bug #1768592, fixing the lxc cache prep
resolvers issue. The pip_install role SHA bump was also required
to get CentOS host builds to a working state.

Change-Id: I8523c34af069d097c9ffb46cbc9a16f87cc84fb1
Related-Bug: #1768592

commit_message:
Add Neutron L3 agent failover check during upgrade

Commit 71aaf58e6f263321c6119bcb2ae9f6f93176941d introduced checks
to detect if L3 agent failover happens during FFU.
This change invokes aforementioned checks during major upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic8baf78d82c4c58eb5d974767b00717c5664072c
(cherry picked from commit cec6d97351e0bbf2e1a748f4fa65a4c28c3a757e)

Regenerate overcloudrc on upgrade and ffwd-upgrade (prepare)

Closes-Bug: #1761499

commit_message:
Remove no-ops from user-env too

Only removing them from plan-env could get the no-ops re-inserted by
accident from user-env on next plan update, if the next plan-update
action would be done with user-env persistence (any of update/upgrade
operations).

Change-Id: Ib9cfff3e38cb05ffe03b6ba06498d0655119b97d
Closes-Bug: #1761499

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 21:19:10.000000000', 'message': "Python 3: Fix non-deterministic test

The order that kill() is called on the child processes of a service is
determined by iterating over a dict, so don't hard-code a particular
expected order in the test. Doing that caused the test to be broken on
Python 3.

Change-Id: I4ca85cc8f559985b133e523cd00f297e5576d00a
"}]
commit_message:
Python 3: Fix non-deterministic test

The order that kill() is called on the child processes of a service is
determined by iterating over a dict, so don't hard-code a particular
expected order in the test. Doing that caused the test to be broken on
Python 3.

Change-Id: I4ca85cc8f559985b133e523cd00f297e5576d00a

Adds for all invocations of the ffwd-upgrade prepare, run and

under development and to be used with caution. The operator
must type 'yes' in order to proceed, or set the new --yes

and testing further mature the ffwd upgrade workflow.

(cherry picked from commit c3ee58d2a0f0c073e205a8d7ad6db49aa2f67eb0)
"}]
commit_message:
Add warning + required confirm for ffwd-upgrade cli --yes to skip

Adds for all invocations of the ffwd-upgrade prepare, run and
converge a warning to the operator that ffwd-upgrade is still
under development and to be used with caution. The operator
must type 'yes' in order to proceed, or set the new --yes
parameter added here.

We can revisit this warning as development
and testing further mature the ffwd upgrade workflow.

Change-Id: Ie2279cba2f710747e93a9784d474f81ae199636e
(cherry picked from commit c3ee58d2a0f0c073e205a8d7ad6db49aa2f67eb0)

subject: tasks: main: Wipe preconfigured /etc/pip.conf file
messages:
[{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:28:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-02 13:41:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> (1 comment)

So one problem that I noticed is this

HTTPError: 404 Client Error: Not Found for url: http://mirror.gra1.ovh.openstack.org/pypi/simple/pkg-resources/

from

http://logs.openstack.org/06/562606/12/check/openstack-ansible-functional-ubuntu-xenial/de2aedd/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-02_11_04_29_831359

So the reason for that is that the index in openstack mirrors does not have an entry for pkg-resources so the index-url and extra-index-url in the pip.conf file make virtualenv/pip to fail with the previous error

This happens when we are using distribution packages for virtualenv/pip though. Overall I think that we shouldn't have such a file around since we already create one in the pip_install role for the hosts which need a configured pip on them.

However, now that I think about it, for the source/distro stuff, we may need a configured pip so this role probably needs a new variable to control whether we want to configure PIP or not."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-02 15:11:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, OK - if you go ahead with something like this then it should be implemented for tests only... not in production. We do not want to overwrite or interfere with a production environment's pip.conf if it's there."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-04 16:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

lets not do this right now'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 13:13:52.000000000', 'message': "tasks: main: Wipe preconfigured /etc/pip.conf file

Zuul places a /etc/pip.conf file on the host as shown below

2018-05-02 11:48:59.945452 | TASK [configure-mirrors : Install /etc/pip.conf configuration]

However, we don't need that since we have our own role to configure pip
which overrides the Zuul one anyway. For the hosts which are not
configured with the pip_install role, this can actually cause problems
so we wipe the file and we let our own role configure it the way we want
to.

Change-Id: I23c87d5035ddb2bd0d085ecc01633fa5a1ab9488
"}]
commit_message:
tasks: main: Wipe preconfigured /etc/pip.conf file

Zuul places a /etc/pip.conf file on the host as shown below

2018-05-02 11:48:59.945452 | TASK [configure-mirrors : Install /etc/pip.conf configuration]

However, we don't need that since we have our own role to configure pip
which overrides the Zuul one anyway. For the hosts which are not
configured with the pip_install role, this can actually cause problems
so we wipe the file and we let our own role configure it the way we want
to.

Change-Id: I23c87d5035ddb2bd0d085ecc01633fa5a1ab9488

commit_message:
Run console proxies per cell instead of globally

Along with converting to the database backend for console token auth,
the console proxies need to run per cell instead of globally. This way,
the instance UUID isn't needed in the access url as users will be
handed an access url local to the cell their instances is in. With
console proxies sharded across cells, a large cloud will no longer have
a bottleneck of one console proxy for the entire deployment.

This also disables the novnc tempest tests with a TODO to re-enable
them once the nova patch series that converts from the nova-consoleauth
backend -> cell database backend lands.

Change-Id: I67894a31b887a93de26f3d2d8a1fa84be5b9ea89

commit_message:
Make ceph clean job stable

This PS makes ceph's client-key clean job stable by precreating the role
and rolebinding resources for the job, thereby removing the potential
for the race conditions. This is related to
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558981/

commit_message:
Clarify image_source with BFV

Clarify the documentation and the returned error
in order to help users understand the behavior of
BFV and the storage interface.

Change-Id: I7719ae1acf5102cdd7ed39fd2fee427fdc25e78a
Story: #2001927
Task: #14455

Following the features of oslo.config and oslo generation tool, I didn't get the reason that why should we have this namespace in this?

> There is no valid reason is shown here.

Please give me an explanation for your -1? Why did we need oslo.config namespace meanwhile we are using oslo.config in cinder to load values that were configured in cinder.conf with a config-file path which we really have given for CONF?'}, {'account_id': 19930, 'date': '2017-10-02 02:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-05-04 15:56:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Why is this not needed?  When I look at the sample cinder.conf file
 > I do see the config_file and config_dir directories listed.  I
 > think we will lose that if we remove the namespace.  Can you please
 > explain why this isn't needed anymore?

Those probably shouldn't be in the sample config file because they can't be set from a config file.  They're CLI opts that are used to find the config file(s) to load.  By the time the files are parsed it's too late to change these options."}]

commit_message:
Remove oslo.config from cinder-config-generator

We don't need this namespace for config generation.

Change-Id: Ia93f80f5047fde9bef9cef705383f362abe3e799

commit_message:
Revert "Restore iscsi loopback LVM volume group on startup"

This reverts commit b8f15088b5c3b70ae2c12ecd8185064a0159a6e1.

The original commit failed to fully address the problem it tried
to solve, and is causing additional problems.

Closes-Bug: #1768833
Change-Id: I9126e5acaf16a39528c65e756eb475dc62e1ab40
Conflicts:
	manifests/setup_test_volume.pp

commit_message:
Update property keys document

The list of useful image properties really belongs in the Glance
Administration Guide.  The only connection they have with the
glanceclient is that you can use it to set them.  Rewrite the
property keys document to reflect this.  The dependency moves the
relevant text to the Glance Admin Guide.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/565780
Change-Id: I39add6728aad42988a07d2ad97cd81dbdaf4c54a

commit_message:
Add IPv6 kernel module

The nf_conntrack_ipv6 kernel module was missing and prohibiting proper
IPv6 support. this change ensures the module is loaded by default.

Change-Id: I3e45ac1af26d592761e89fd1c7232bdfea879673
Closes-Bug: #1738451
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
gate: ceph; reuse fsid if it exists

don't regenerate the ceph fsid if we already have one, this means we
can have piecemeal use of the gate and developer scripts

Change-Id: Ib988679a06151850226f30b9a6432fbe202f1514

commit_message:
Add Heat to StoryBoard

Adds all heat repos according to governance/projects.yaml
to the heat group and enable use-storyboard: true for each
repo.

Change-Id: Ib9f12198e10a0e1b1c1d11f42b7ddafa810438b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 17:02:03.000000000', 'message': 'Take lock before unlinking db files

Use a lock to deal with the following scenarios:

1. The _misplaced_objects handler in process A is removing misplaced
object rows from db while an rsync_then_merge in process B
concurrently attempts to relink the db file, potentially causing
misplaced row ranges to be removed from a different db from which they
were moved.

Now, _misplaced_objects will contend for a lock with rsync_then_merge,
and once lock is acquired will confirm the db id is that from which
rows were moved.

2. An rsync_then_merge in process A re-links retiring db concurrently
with a _complete_sharding in process B unlinking the retiring db
(requires the rsync_then_merge to have been in progress since before
sharding began)

Now, rsync_then_merge will contend for lock with _complete_sharding
and check the old db file still exists before renaming its new db
file.

3. usync merge in process A writes rows to retiring db concurrently
with a _complete_sharding in process B unlinking the retiring db
(requires the usync to have been in progress since before sharding
began)

Now, usync will contend for lock with _complete_sharding and check the
old db file still exists before returning success.

This patch also catches sqlite3 exceptions raised if a db file is
unlinked while a usync (or rsync_then_merge) is attempting write (or
read) the db. An HTTPFound will now be returned in response to the
REPLICATE request if this happens.

Change-Id: I1bbc7384143b79c86b1aea943f4964426be35787

commit_message:
Take lock before unlinking db files

Use a lock to deal with the following scenarios:

1. The _misplaced_objects handler in process A is removing misplaced
object rows from db while an rsync_then_merge in process B
concurrently attempts to relink the db file, potentially causing
misplaced row ranges to be removed from a different db from which they
were moved.

Now, _misplaced_objects will contend for a lock with rsync_then_merge,
and once lock is acquired will confirm the db id is that from which
rows were moved.

2. An rsync_then_merge in process A re-links retiring db concurrently
with a _complete_sharding in process B unlinking the retiring db
(requires the rsync_then_merge to have been in progress since before
sharding began).

Now, rsync_then_merge will contend for lock with _complete_sharding
and check the old db file still exists before renaming its new db
file.

3. usync merge in process A writes rows to retiring db concurrently
with a _complete_sharding in process B unlinking the retiring db
(requires the usync to have been in progress since before sharding
began).

Now, usync will contend for lock with _complete_sharding and check the
old db file still exists before returning success.

This patch also catches sqlite3 exceptions raised if a db file is
unlinked while a usync (or rsync_then_merge) is attempting write (or
read) the db. An HTTPFound will now be returned in response to the
REPLICATE request if this happens.

Change-Id: I1bbc7384143b79c86b1aea943f4964426be35787

commit_message:
Add gather_facts into undercloud upgrades playbook.

Tripleo-upgrade role, in its stable/pike branch,
makes use of some of the ansible facts. As by
default we have disabled the facts gathering in
oooq, we need to include it in the task.

Change-Id: I9ebfaab5554c7778ea94cf262eaec71c9b799f1e
Closes-Bug: #1769103

commit_message:
Remove reference to Exact* filters

The nova-scheduler Exact* baremetal filters were deprecated
in Pike and are now being removed in Rocky. This updates the
documentation to remove the mention of those filters.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/508886/
Change-Id: I81be9736e540b6faa2877bb05205fb5e11b46ed4

Live-restore is not support by redhat[1]. We need
to disable option by default.

[1] https://access.redhat.com/solutions/2991041

commit_message:
Update minimum requirements

All of our CI jobs run with at least 8 vcpus, so we might as well
indicate 8 is the minimum.

Also update supported OS's and minimum RAM.

Change-Id: Ie77661e04294ca64c0463c4261f35dc3fb813b5b

subject: fix link to openstacksdk in deprecation block
messages:
[{'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:43:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2018-05-04 13:24:06.000000000', 'message': "Add Ceph upgrade tasks

Ceph upgrade is done with dedicated command.
This change adds tasks to create ceph upgrade scripts and
perform actual ceph upgrade.
Ceph upgrade would be run just in case ceph_osd service is present
in the list stack's enabled services

(cherry picked from commit 23ee1030573649ac7a5b80bdc931470687855dbb)
Depends-On: Ic07128020ddfc72090907f17176c08a803b8920a

Change-Id: Ifc24fad18ab03afb0cd9f800f5e6dbeea92b0e2f
"}]
commit_message:
Add Ceph upgrade tasks

Ceph upgrade is done with dedicated command.
This change adds tasks to create ceph upgrade scripts and
perform actual ceph upgrade.
Ceph upgrade would be run just in case ceph_osd service is present
in the list stack's enabled services

(cherry picked from commit 23ee1030573649ac7a5b80bdc931470687855dbb)
Depends-On: Ic07128020ddfc72090907f17176c08a803b8920a

Change-Id: Ifc24fad18ab03afb0cd9f800f5e6dbeea92b0e2f

commit_message:
api-ref: several fixes on security group rules

* Fix the attributes 'remote_ip_prefix' and 'direction' that were
  messed up with metering rules.
* Fix the attributes 'ethertype', 'port_range_max', 'port_range_min'
  and 'remote_group_id' that have the wrong required/optional.
* Add the missing query parameter 'remote_ip_prefix'
* Remove an extra ` in remote_group_id

Change-Id: I92ff1ad5921695c569c8c831a70d388a7900809c

subject: task: main: Run the pip_install role on all distros
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-05-02 19:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-05-02 19:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-05-04 13:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 19:06:45.000000000', 'message': "task: main: Run the pip_install role on all distros

For source based installations we need to have a working pip environment
so it's necessary to use the pip_install role for now which ensures that
proper versions of pip (+friends) is installed and that a proper
pip.conf file is placed on the host.

Change-Id: Ib2b90319a5fb1eef129a75c43bf9f5a480557768
"}]
commit_message:
task: main: Run the pip_install role on all distros

For source based installations we need to have a working pip environment
so it's necessary to use the pip_install role for now which ensures that
proper versions of pip (+friends) is installed and that a proper
pip.conf file is placed on the host.

Change-Id: Ib2b90319a5fb1eef129a75c43bf9f5a480557768

[{'created': '2018-05-02 12:50:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix devstack/local.conf.sample

The commit b7548d21a95c523d5201b451f329212bb5b8dc39 added a line in the
local.conf.sample file to enable the neutron-tempest-plugin by default
but, the author (myself in that case) forgot to prepend a

commit_message:
Fix devstack/local.conf.sample

The commit b7548d21a95c523d5201b451f329212bb5b8dc39 added a line in the
local.conf.sample file to enable the neutron-tempest-plugin by default
but, the author (myself in that case) forgot to prepend a
"enable_plugin" call in front of that line.

Reported-by: Axel Tripier <axel@tripier.fr>
Change-Id: I495fd8e96a5fc16b3d65b04ea60f8217043a5a79

commit_message:
Bump lxc_host role

This enables the fix for bug #1768592, fixing the lxc cache prep
resolvers issue.

Change-Id: I8523c34af069d097c9ffb46cbc9a16f87cc84fb1
Related-Bug: #1768592

[{'created': '2018-05-03 12:36:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lxc cache prep resolvers

Recent changes in the upstream LXC images have resulted in breakage
caused by busted symlinks, likely to the image moving to
"systemd-resolved". This change backports the process we use in master
to create the cache resolvers which will ensure we're not having to deal
with this issue.

Change-Id: I3769053956b958a0ac7cab499ea90af2a40de850
Related-Change: I1775e775bbb7fe86bdffdd8296c2cff5ebc5bac8
Closes-Bug: #1768592
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e77c3a923bc8aae4a264917f592b58b5d1c79aed)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lxc cache prep resolvers

Recent changes in the upstream LXC images have resulted in breakage
caused by busted symlinks, likely to the image moving to
"systemd-resolved". This change backports the process we use in master
to create the cache resolvers which will ensure we're not having to deal
with this issue.

Change-Id: I3769053956b958a0ac7cab499ea90af2a40de850
Related-Change: I1775e775bbb7fe86bdffdd8296c2cff5ebc5bac8
Closes-Bug: #1768592
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e77c3a923bc8aae4a264917f592b58b5d1c79aed)

commit_message:
Update references of neutron services

networking-odl/devstack is using lib/neutron instead of lib/neutron-legacy
there were references that were not updated in previous patches. This
updates the remaining references.

Change-Id: I1eca11848936e00d5e4dcfef7206069936e370e1

commit_message:
Stop gating on tripleo-incubator

This project is no longer maintained and we are in the process of
retiring it officially.

Related-Bug: #1768590

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop MIN_LIBVIRT_REALTIME_VERSION

The updated minimum required libvirt (1.3.1) and QEMU (2.5.0) for
"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also remove the now no longer needed exception
RealtimePolicyNotSupported().

From my examination of unit tests, no unit tests need to be removed.
The existing two tests with 'realtime' in the test name should remain:

  - test_get_guest_memory_backing_config_realtime()
  - test_get_guest_config_numa_host_instance_cpu_pinning_realtime()

Change-Id: Ieaa615f97a26569dd3b1ec176d6bb6fd8e634882
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop MIN_QEMU_POSTCOPY_VERSION

The updated minimum required QEMU (2.5.0) for "Rocky" matches this now,
so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also adjust the relevant unit test.

Change-Id: Icf2c35042dfe9a8044d735f3d2cf27208fe211dc
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop BAD_LIBVIRT_CPU_POLICY_VERSIONS

The updated minimum required libvirt (1.3.1) and QEMU (2.5.0) for
"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also remove / fix relevant unit tests.

Change-Id: I16c25a43f5a3b6b9761804b8cb544347bbed95bf
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-04 10:34:11.000000000', 'message': "Don't install any packages via pip

This patch ensures that we don't install any packages outside of a
virtualenv with pip.

CentOS has issues with python modules which are installed with pip
and are later installed with yum. Yum doesn't understand how to deal
with a package installation when some files are already there from
that package.

Closes-Bug: 1715888
Change-Id: I79e439f73e9d2790cb7a1327c1e1f4808b073e46
(cherry picked from commit 80594e3787adb52661429b00949ab7eebdbfd10d)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install any packages via pip

This patch ensures that we don't install any packages outside of a
virtualenv with pip.

CentOS has issues with python modules which are installed with pip
and are later installed with yum. Yum doesn't understand how to deal
with a package installation when some files are already there from
that package.

Closes-Bug: 1715888
Change-Id: I79e439f73e9d2790cb7a1327c1e1f4808b073e46
(cherry picked from commit 80594e3787adb52661429b00949ab7eebdbfd10d)

commit_message:
Fix entrypoints for quotas

currently they are pointing to non-existing code/classes which breaks
all sort of things, including bash completion in openstackclient.

Change-Id: I89e266b9d85f4168fd593ad9a05878b902e5315e
Closes-Bug: #1762316
(cherry picked from commit 1dec8995fb76faa2cc62e7aeb6c024cb80b97ece)

The capabilities filter gets incorrectly blamed for a lot of

commit_message:
Add logging to capabilities filter

The capabilities filter gets incorrectly blamed for a lot of
deployment failures because on a retry of a node deployment the
filter has to fail because there is only one node that can match
when using predictable placement.  However, we don't have any
logging to help determine why the filter fails.  This adds logging
to explain why nodes fell through, which will hopefully help with
debugging these problems.

Change-Id: I702209e9b5a1e546bf8cb784eec8bdc3c97c63eb
Closes-Bug: 1718502

commit_message:
Change ovs RuntimeDirectory Mode

when updating ovs to 2.8+, ovs and qemu share the
same group hugetlbfs, but for existing vhostusermode
interfaces located at /var/run/openvswitch dir, qemu
can't access them after ovs update, because the dir
has default 0755 mode instead of a group write
permission. This change is going to add g+w mode to
/var/run/openvswitch.

Change-Id: If9687fee5171d395585d72a923b50903a94297a7
Related-Bug: #1764971

[{'created': '2018-04-24 13:19:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix the missing region name information for Keystone client

When using several regions, Rally's Keystone client does not use
the region endpoint specified in the context. So we added
the region name used in credentials to be able to connect
to the correct region endpoint

Change-Id: I441aee8ffb82963396d40405ea740276edc7dfe5
Co-Authored-By: rcherrueau <Ronan-Alexandre.Cherrueau@inria.fr>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the missing region name information for Keystone client

When using several regions, Rally's Keystone client does not use
the region endpoint specified in the context. So we added
the region name used in credentials to be able to connect
to the correct region endpoint

Change-Id: I441aee8ffb82963396d40405ea740276edc7dfe5
Co-Authored-By: rcherrueau <Ronan-Alexandre.Cherrueau@inria.fr>

This is an upgrade job for containerized undercloud, we don't want to
test idempotency, it takes too much time.

commit_message:
WIP: Revert "Only update plan on upgrade converge" and more

This reverts commit f2affa0e64f6666672000e12f005609a67753860 and
also adds the stack update to the minor update and ffwd-upgrade
converge.

A new workflow parameter run_heat_stack_update is added for each
of updates/upgrade/ffwd_upgrade converge so that the heat stack
update is run only conditionally.

Bug: TODO (this is based on discussions on Friday)
Change-Id: Id1216e8cfcaf3516ca9c1d353c532124eb0de365

commit_message:
DRBD: Remove cast to int in size calculation

In Python2.x, "int" is 32bit only, and so this overflows for 2TiB
volumes. If we remove the casting to int before return, then it
works for python 2 and 3.

This is a resubmission of 395132

Change-Id: I3e4814ee066df5726b0a2b599961511c2516135b

commit_message:
Move o-hm0 dhcp config under /etc/dhcp

Apparmor will block dhclient from accessing the o-hm0 configuration file
under /etc/octavia. This patch moves our dhclient.conf under /etc/dhcp/octavia
to allow the dhclient to access the file when apparmor is running.

Change-Id: I3153f8bd9237470f406a9edeb4e2a0767fc747b8
Story: 1673269
Task: 5434

commit_message:
Add Neutron L3 agent failover check during upgrade

Commit 71aaf58e6f263321c6119bcb2ae9f6f93176941d introduced checks
to detect if L3 agent failover happens during FFU.
This change invokes aforementioned checks during major upgrade.

Change-Id: Ic8baf78d82c4c58eb5d974767b00717c5664072c

commit_message:
Fix post gate hook to accommodate for new os-testr

New os-testr uses stestr under the hood, which creates .stestr but not
.testrepository directory in the current dir. Other than that, it
doesn't seem like there is any difference in the format or names of
files generated in the directory.

Change-Id: I82d52bf0ad885bd36d2f0782a7c86ac61df532f2
Closes-Bug: #1716746

commit_message:
Skip running py36 tests on irrelevant files

Local test run definitions were added for running with Python
3.6 as a temporary test. These should eventually go away, but
in the meantime, skip running these on things like docs changes.

Change-Id: Idc42028d4c31d9ee31cdcea11b8749fffa5007b4

commit_message:
Expose Horizon "DocumentRoot" on host

This will allow webroot plugin for Let's Encrypt to actually work.
The container has no need to write in this location.

Change-Id: Ia76a0cc007abfdec6f25e1371eb696864f2925fd
Closes-Bug: 1768519

commit_message:
Fix proper versions pinning for test

Due to the bad references of selected branches the CI
tests are currently failing on stable/ocata.
This patchset fixes this issue

Change-Id: I51925f7e1afa4007123f5690a282fd4a09e29b5b

commit_message:
Add missed post-controller scripts

Post upgrade checks that checks services' status on overcloud:
 - check rabbitmq
 - check redis
 - check haproxy
 - check haproxy_backend

Change-Id: I6f53663bfbe4217b7d3d26cc01774733726c97c3
(cherry picked from commit 22b5394f1a1971a65ce645fc7aa9054ffacb96c0)

subject: Allow OVA upload for images
messages:
[{'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-20 14:35:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-03-20 14:35:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-20 14:56:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thanks for your first contribution. Nice fix!
Comments on minor improvements are found inline.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-20 16:33:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:00:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-21 14:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The unit test failure is due to the difference of expected parameter names.
api.glance.create_image_metadata expects "minimum_disk" but api.rest.glance uses 'min_disk' and this name is used to communicate with AngularJS code.

I think it is not enough just to move create_image_metadata to a common place. We also need to adjust the difference of parameter names.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:30:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Although I haven't checked the latest patch set, I am happy to help this patch. If you have troubles, feel free to comment here. I would like to investigate this weekend."}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:53:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I just have some doubts about the way I implemented it.
I modified api/glance.py in order to handle both cases (min and minumum). So I don't have to modify all occurences of minimum_disk."}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-22 18:43:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-23 10:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-26 16:55:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-27 12:48:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-03-27 16:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-09 14:55:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

The proposed logic seems to work, but IMHO it is better to handle the difference of field names outside of create_image_metadata method. Especially, I don't think the logic around 'visibility' and 'is_public/public' is easy to be maintained."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-10 01:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)

Some cleanup can be done separately later. Other my inline comments are hopefully addressed before merging this.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-04-10 14:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-04-10 16:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Patch Set 13 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-04-11 08:21:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15: Patch Set 14 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-15 04:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-15 04:56:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-15 05:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(1 comment)

You optimized the logic but a corner case is missing. I cannot change the visibility from Public to Private in the Angular Edit Image form. The regression test seems not enough.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-15 08:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-15 08:59:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-15 09:18:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-16 02:21:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

I updated the patch based on my local testing and past comments. I hope you don't mind it. The diff can be checked in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554572/15..17 .

(Note that DevStack on the CI is broken now so horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin is failing.)"}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18: Patch Set 17 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:57:08.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1641383 to bug/1757136'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-21 19:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-04-23 21:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24710, 'date': '2018-05-04 10:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit d8b43d58b2d092c908f6dfd28a7cbab87c5936e9'}]

commit_message:
Allow OVA upload for images

Bug #1641383 was not fixed for REST API call.
The two implementation of create_image_metadata are merged
into api/glance.py.

There were minor differences in field naming and handling
(min_ vs minimum_, is_public vs public vs visibility).
This commit normalizes them to simplify the logic.

Closes-Bug: #1757136
Change-Id: I41e9d94345151bc4473d704cdc040ed77870ce45

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-01 12:19:11.000000000', 'message': 'Doug Hellmann nomination for Chair

I would be honored to serve as chair for the TC for this session.

With Thierry stepping down as chair, this session will be the first
time the TC as it stands today is chaired by someone from outside of
the Foundation staff. This is an important step for us, to show not
only that our principle of Changes in Leadership are Good applies to
the TC, but that our leaders can and will place the needs of the
community first. Over the 6 years I have been contributing to
OpenStack and the 4+ years I have served on the TC, I have been
employed by 3 separate companies. I hope my history of service within
the community reassures everyone of my continued impartiality.

The nature of the TC and the issues it has had to address have changed
in significant ways several times while I have been involved.

When the TC addressed fundamental questions about what types of
projects should be included in the community, and OpenStack expanded
from a simple IaaS project to our current mission of producing the
ubiquitous Open Source Cloud Computing platform, I helped navigate
that change, first as a member of the Ceilometer team (one of the
first teams to be added to OpenStack without being spawned from an
existing project), and later as a TC member drafting early versions of
the Big Tent resolution.

When our community went through a period of intensive growth, as
companies joined and brought new features and formed new projects, I
helped organize the Oslo and release teams to cope with that growth by
implementing the liaison system and driving more use of automation.

More recently, as we have seen some leveling off, or even reduction,
of contributors, I worked with the documentation and requirements
teams to accommodate the contraction by shifting documentation from a
central location into team-owned repositories and by simplifying the
way we manage dependency settings in each project. These changes
reduced the friction for contributors to those projects.

Those experiences have prepared me to help us through this next
transition, as well.

My goals for this session are to have a smooth transition and to help
the TC work together as a team to achieve our shared objectives. I
have a few things I would like to change about the way we organize
ourselves based on patterns we have seen work well elsewhere,
including using sub-teams of TC members to manage our recurring
responsibilities more actively.

I look forward to talking with you about the future of the TC over the
next few weeks.

Change-Id: I35a4b1501b0019e79b34cc92f83af38ea4a41c26
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Doug Hellmann nomination for Chair

I would be honored to serve as chair for the TC for this session.

With Thierry stepping down as chair, this session will be the first
time the TC as it stands today is chaired by someone from outside of
the Foundation staff. This is an important step for us, to show not
only that our principle of Changes in Leadership are Good applies to
the TC, but that our leaders can and will place the needs of the
community first. Over the 6 years I have been contributing to
OpenStack and the 4+ years I have served on the TC, I have been
employed by 3 separate companies. I hope my history of service within
the community reassures everyone of my continued impartiality.

The nature of the TC and the issues it has had to address have changed
in significant ways several times while I have been involved.

When the TC addressed fundamental questions about what types of
projects should be included in the community, and OpenStack expanded
from a simple IaaS project to our current mission of producing the
ubiquitous Open Source Cloud Computing platform, I helped navigate
that change, first as a member of the Ceilometer team (one of the
first teams to be added to OpenStack without being spawned from an
existing project), and later as a TC member drafting early versions of
the Big Tent resolution.

When our community went through a period of intensive growth, as
companies joined and brought new features and formed new projects, I
helped organize the Oslo and release teams to cope with that growth by
implementing the liaison system and driving more use of automation.

More recently, as we have seen some leveling off, or even reduction,
of contributors, I worked with the documentation and requirements
teams to accommodate the contraction by shifting documentation from a
central location into team-owned repositories and by simplifying the
way we manage dependency settings in each project. These changes
reduced the friction for contributors to those projects.

Those experiences have prepared me to help us through this next
transition, as well.

My goals for this session are to have a smooth transition and to help
the TC work together as a team to achieve our shared objectives. I
have a few things I would like to change about the way we organize
ourselves based on patterns we have seen work well elsewhere,
including using sub-teams of TC members to manage our recurring
responsibilities more actively.

I look forward to talking with you about the future of the TC over the
next few weeks.

Change-Id: I35a4b1501b0019e79b34cc92f83af38ea4a41c26
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I96bf556c6d632b9cb8a2f4e9a1b2cf8d7fd15fa4

commit_message:
WIP Delete messages container in delete_stack

The new config-download workflow creates a XXX-messages swift container
to persist the zaqar messages for the UI to consume. We need to remove
that container on stack delete otherwise the UI thinks the stack is
still deployed when it's effectively deleted.

Change-Id: Ic82cad9c8fedc7b3b72fed70b2f2661256cd3d63

commit_message:
Add warning + required confirm for ffwd-upgrade cli --yes to skip

Adds for all invocations of the ffwd-upgrade prepare, run and
converge a warning to the operator that ffwd-upgrade is still
under development and to be used with caution. The operator
must type 'yes' in order to proceed, or set the new --yes
parameter added here.

We can revisit this warning as development
and testing further mature the ffwd upgrade workflow.

Change-Id: Ie2279cba2f710747e93a9784d474f81ae199636e

commit_message:
Remove dead dependency injection code

This code was superceded by the provider_api module. We should
continue using that module instead. This module isn't used anymore
and it should start getting phased out.

Change-Id: Ib3a494e04c58f0b91fa63b48312702ab0d2f74d2

commit_message:
Remove uuid as keystone_token_provider

Keystone removed uuid token provider in Rocky

This patch change the default value and fix comments for the option.

Change-Id: Idca0004852b688fcdd34ef47c38dec6b8bf05f86
Closes-Bug: #1757520

commit_message:
Fix the request context in ServiceFixture

Multiple cells are not considered in ServiceFixture.
So all compute nodes are registered to only one cell (cell1)
database regardless of their cells.
So change the ServiceFixture to use a request context
for the cell where the service runs.

Change-Id: I6e940518c6ec27c02c714db6c124eb88c72214ab
Closes-Bug: #1759792

Add missing 'transfer' parameter in API document

This patch adds the missing parameter 'transfer' to accept
transfer's API document.

Thanks to both of you for getting this started.  I am not certain if you plan to continue the work.  If you don't, please let a reviewer know so we can fix up the review.  The main reason the gate is failing is because the resource.yaml file is malformatted with a bootstrap section that is unnecessary.

You can see this in the gate logs here where kollakube res create is done and bootstrap is parsed.  kollakube res create is going away hopefully in 0.7.0.

http://logs.openstack.org/52/437252/4/check/gate-kolla-kubernetes-python27-ubuntu-xenial/ac75d8a/console.html.gz#_2017-03-10_22_13_31_817788

Would really like this patch finished if possible by then :)

Thanks!
-steve"}, {'account_id': 22582, 'date': '2017-04-17 07:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 22582, 'date': '2017-04-17 07:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

This looks really good. Thanks for working on this.

Any chance we could get a basic heat test added to tests/bin/basic_tests.sh ? Heat's the only service we're supporting that has no functional tests.

Maybe do something really simple like a single resource template with a ServerGroup in it? It should heat stack-create -f template.yaml test very quickly then. Something like (untested):

HeatTemplateFormatVersion: '2012-12-12'
Description: test
Resources:
  ServerGroup:
    Properties:
      name: test
      policies:
        - anti-affinity

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This looks really good. Thanks for working on this.
 > 
 > Any chance we could get a basic heat test added to
 > tests/bin/basic_tests.sh ? Heat's the only service we're supporting
 > that has no functional tests.
 > 
 > Maybe do something really simple like a single resource template
 > with a ServerGroup in it? It should heat stack-create -f
 > template.yaml test very quickly then. Something like (untested):
 > 
 > HeatTemplateFormatVersion: '2012-12-12'
 > Description: test
 > Resources:
 > ServerGroup:
 > Properties:
 > name: test
 > policies:

Heat service deployment

PS adds Heat service deployment.

Co-Authored-By: Balaji Pattewar <balaji.pattewar@oracle.com>
Change-Id: Ic89ce6b0793bf3b0bb946051bdf4d6401ef352ef
Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-services

commit_message:
[WIP]: FIP port forwarding support[3]

This patch expose the API in neutron-lib.

Patch List:
[1] Extend L3 agent extension and necessary works in backend.
[2] Create new service plugin for port forwarding and fulfill db layer
work.
[3] Extend the current fip API.

Change-Id: I8fcd28698cc636b69d9ac6cc85b8767d93f8724b

do_execute, so it's a good idea to move it to the base
class
