subject: Drop partition creation with ceph-volume
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-05-03 15:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2018-05-04 05:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLooks great, thanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 15:43:31.000000000', 'message': "Drop partition creation with ceph-volume

If a block device is due to be used for a LVM PV, don't bother
creating a single partition as its not required and just adds
a layer of complexity.

This also allows partitions or bcache devices to be consumed
as block devices for ceph OSD's.

Change-Id: I6fac0c781e269c229fb4781dd6683a7236d8e960
"}]
commit_message:
Drop partition creation with ceph-volume

If a block device is due to be used for a LVM PV, don't bother
creating a single partition as its not required and just adds
a layer of complexity.

This also allows partitions or bcache devices to be consumed
as block devices for ceph OSD's.

Change-Id: I6fac0c781e269c229fb4781dd6683a7236d8e960

commit_message:
Allowing Non-IP Traffic in L2 and L3 domains

Non-IP traffic is allowed in L2 and L3 Domains
The default_allow_non_ip setting determines if non-ip traffic is
allowed in Nuage specific L2 and L3 domains.

commit_message:
Clarify how to generate kolla-build.conf in docs

image-building.rst does not mention where to find the
necessary files to generate kolla-build.conf with tox.

This patch clarifies that you need to check out the git
repository first and also that it is technically not
necessary to generate the kolla-build.conf file.

Change-Id: Ifd6ed216e5086b935ca399b1613319d67424d5ae
Closes-Bug: #1744453

commit_message:
Let haproxy to be ODL websocket's frontend

This PS does:
1) Let haproxy to be ODL websocket's frontend and listen on port 8185.
2) Add 10-rest-connector.xml config file template for ODL container.
3) ODL websocket backend listen only on api interface, port is also
8185.

Closes-Bug: #1745323

Change-Id: Id330d610c7cd8a239b0f77c8f5f47422d48b9977
Signed-off-by: Zhijiang Hu <hu.zhijiang@zte.com.cn>

[{'created': '2017-11-20 19:29:24.000000000', 'message': "Move context middleware to front of pipeline

Until the context middleware has been processed, logs from any other
middleware will be logged with the request ID of the *previous* request.
Currently this is most logs in the API log files, which makes the request
ID worse than useless for determining what is going on.

To ensure all logs get the correct request ID, move the context middleware
close to the front of the pipeline, right after the request_id middleware
that generates the request ID. Also, explicitly include the request_id
middleware in the cfn-compatibility APIs' pipelines.

Change-Id: I097bf70431a999a0f6aa56079ffb5743b50d4d7f
"}, {'created': '2017-11-20 21:18:29.000000000', 'message': "Move context middleware earlier in pipeline

Until the context middleware has been processed, logs from any other
middleware will be logged with the request ID of the *previous* request.
Currently this is most logs in the API log files, which makes the request
ID worse than useless for determining what is going on.

To ensure all logs get the correct request ID, move the context middleware
close to the front of the pipeline, right after the request_id middleware
that generates the request ID and the auth middleware (the data from which
is needed to populate the context). Also, explicitly include the request_id
middleware in the cfn-compatibility APIs' pipelines.

Unfortunately, any failures in the auth middleware will still be logged
with the wrong request ID. This appears to be unavoidable, since we can't
create the context until after we have authenticated the request.

Change-Id: I097bf70431a999a0f6aa56079ffb5743b50d4d7f
"}, {'created': '2018-01-31 20:02:50.000000000', 'message': "Move context middleware earlier in pipeline

that generates the request ID and the auth middleware (the data from which
is needed to populate the context). Also, explicitly include the request_id

Change-Id: I097bf70431a999a0f6aa56079ffb5743b50d4d7f

commit_message:
Move context middleware earlier in pipeline

Until the context middleware has been processed, logs from any other
middleware will be logged with the request ID of the *previous* request.
Currently this is most logs in the API log files, which makes the request
ID worse than useless for determining what is going on.

To ensure all logs get the correct request ID, move the context middleware
close to the front of the pipeline, right after the request_id middleware
that generates the request ID and the auth middleware (the data from which
is needed to populate the context). Also, explicitly include the request_id
middleware in the cfn-compatibility APIs' pipelines.

Unfortunately, any failures in the auth middleware will still be logged
with the wrong request ID. This appears to be unavoidable, since we can't
create the context until after we have authenticated the request.

Change-Id: I097bf70431a999a0f6aa56079ffb5743b50d4d7f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 15:26:12.000000000', 'message': "Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139
"}]
commit_message:
Handle @safe_connect returns None side effect in _ensure_resource_provider

Change I0c4ca6a81f213277fe7219cb905a805712f81e36 added more error
handling to the _ensure_resource_provider flow but didn't account
for @safe_connect returning None when calling _create_resource_provider
in the case that nova-compute is started before placement is running.
If that happens, we fail with a TypeError during the nova-compute
startup because we put None in the resource provider cache and then
later blindly try to use it because the compute node resource provider
uuid is in the cache, but mapped to None.

This adds the None check back in _ensure_resource_provider and if
None is returned from _create_resource_provider we raise the same
exception that _create_resource_provider would raise if it couldn't
create the provider.

Change-Id: If9e1581db9c1ae14340b787d03c815d243d5a50c
Closes-Bug: #1767139

subject: fix other deadlock
messages:
[{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-05-03 02:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-05-03 02:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

stack looked like this:

    May  3 02:48:37 swiftqa04 container-sharder: Unhandled exception while processing /srv/node/d23/containers/675/728/2a377847d6f90a7ee1f2482563443728/2a377 847d6f90a7ee1f2482563443728.db: 10 seconds: /srv/node/d23/containers/675/728/2a377847d6f90a7ee1f2482563443728/.lock: 
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/sharder.py", line 1466, in _one_shard_cycle
        self._identify_sharding_candidate (broker, node)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/sharder.py", line 392, in _identify_sharding_candidate
        own_shard_ range = broker.get_own_shard_range()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 1801, in get_own_shard_range
     own_shard_range = self._own_shard_range(no_default=no_default)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 17 74, in _own_shard_range
        exclude_others=True)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 1736, in get_shar d_ranges
        exclude_others=exclude_others)]
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 1659, in _get_shard_r ange_rows
        return do_query(conn)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 1640, in do_query
        param s.append(self.path)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 2034, in path
        self.get_info()
      File "/ usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 883, in get_info
        data = self._get_info()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2 .7/dist-packages/swift/container/backend.py", line 822, in _get_info
        self._commit_puts_stale_ok()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-package s/swift/common/db.py", line 732, in _commit_puts_stale_ok
        self.pending_timeout):
      File "/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 17, in __enter __
        return self.gen.next()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/swift/common/utils.py", line 2414, in lock_path
        sleep(sleep_tim e)
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py", line 34, in sleep
        hub.switch()
      File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/ dist-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py", line 294, in switch
        return self.greenlet.switch()
    LockTimeout: 10 seconds: /srv/node/d23/containers/675/72 8/2a377847d6f90a7ee1f2482563443728/.lock'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-05-04 01:27:38.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

in trying to write a test I found that this isn't a deadlock - this traceback was just a regular run of the mill dir lock contention timeout trying to commit items from the .pending file.

nothing to see here."}]

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I592c4d9f16049daa2af6452241ce76c10a06d9c7
Co-Authored-By: Ngo Quoc Cuong <cuongnq@vn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Add missed post-controller scripts

Post upgrade checks that checks services' status on overcloud:
 - check rabbitmq
 - check redis
 - check haproxy
 - check haproxy_backend

The token assertion was no longer used when we removed the v2.0
token API as noted in the commit message of:

  I4c3e35f3565b4b60ae4d00cc2490bd04aba1a800

commit_message:
Remove unused assertions from test_v3.py

These assertions are not used anywhere in keystone's tests. The
assertion for service providers was added but never used:

  I62ec9619d8b187cda80100e383d40b158550b71f

The token assertion was no longer used when we removed the v2.0
token API as noted in the commit message of:

  I4c3e35f3565b4b60ae4d00cc2490bd04aba1a800

Change-Id: If28273c88518df0ba6b75a98f13f123bee574fb5

commit_message:
remove rpc create_connection

The neutron.common.rpc.create_connection function is just a reference to
the Connection class constructor. This patch removes create_connection
and replaces all uses with Connection instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I2f4b24ba732be47fc9911be1e24406fb1ffe821e

commit_message:
Add promote pipeline

This is for a demonstration of how we could promote some artifacts
directly from the gate pipeline without generating them in post.

Change-Id: Id60b5e292b5750d701ec77b51ff73f12becf3cbd

commit_message:
add basic jobs for constellations repository

The repo will only contain sphinx documentation but we want to run the
pep8 job for the configuration file(s). We will add the publishing job
later after the governance change is approved.

Story: #2001702
Change-Id: I1e59068043e3654321ab116efd34324ae469c0cd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I5febb87f90a309db2131a2d169e29281afad81c2

commit_message:
Fix placement URL

In Debian, if using the UWSGI placement thing, then the URL for
the placement API is just:

http://127.0.0.1:8778/

and not:

http://127.0.0.1:8778/placement

This patch fixes the endpoint registration for that case.

Change-Id: I1d8a7dec1bcc5915d99e7e275dc63de0e727f907

commit_message:
Debian is using python3-memcache

Switch from python-memcache to python3-memcache for Debian.
Also uses openstack-dashboard-apache instead of simply
openstack-dashboard (ie: this package contains the Apache
config).

Change-Id: I9c316dd6b3abb758d73760f17b88a393776a873b

commit_message:
Fix handling of connect issues in _ensure_resource_provider

As _create_resource_provider is wrapped by safe_connect, None is a valid return
value that indicates a connect error.

Change-Id: Iab78121b5d85fd7d0b30d8bac3224b37ba61dba7
Closes-Bug: #1768953

subject: Use scheduler hints in derived_parameters workflow
messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-05-03 16:30:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-05-03 20:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nClean cherry pick'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 16:30:20.000000000', 'message': 'Use scheduler hints in derived_parameters workflow

Update the tripleo.derive_params.v1.derived_parameters workflow to use
scheduler hints associated with a given role. The scheduler hints are
used to identify overcloud nodes associated with the role, and take
precedence over nodes identified by their profile/flavor. If a role does
not specify any scheduler hints then the workflow falls back to matching
nodes by profile/flavor.

Add a tripleo.baremetal.v1.nodes_with_node_id workflow that searches
for ironic nodes matching a node placement regex. This workflow is
analogous to the existing nodes_with_profile workflow that searches
for nodes that match a given profile.

Add a tripleo.baremetal.get_node_id Mistral action that returns the node
placement ID (e.g. "controller-0") for a given node, or None if a node
ID is not defined. This is analogous to the existing get_profile action
that returns the profile assigned to the node.

Fix the 'message' published when a derived parameter sub-workflow fails
so it just returns the sub-workflow 'message' and not the entire sub-
workflow result. The 'message' portion is the only part that is meaningful
to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1760659
Change-Id: I7eff355620aecaca49e77112ba491a5f3ce2eed6
(cherry picked from commit e25e8564a42d1074034a76da5412bea4fb77b414)
'}]
commit_message:
Use scheduler hints in derived_parameters workflow

Update the tripleo.derive_params.v1.derived_parameters workflow to use
scheduler hints associated with a given role. The scheduler hints are
used to identify overcloud nodes associated with the role, and take
precedence over nodes identified by their profile/flavor. If a role does
not specify any scheduler hints then the workflow falls back to matching
nodes by profile/flavor.

Add a tripleo.baremetal.v1.nodes_with_node_id workflow that searches
for ironic nodes matching a node placement regex. This workflow is
analogous to the existing nodes_with_profile workflow that searches
for nodes that match a given profile.

Add a tripleo.baremetal.get_node_id Mistral action that returns the node
placement ID (e.g. "controller-0") for a given node, or None if a node
ID is not defined. This is analogous to the existing get_profile action
that returns the profile assigned to the node.

Fix the 'message' published when a derived parameter sub-workflow fails
so it just returns the sub-workflow 'message' and not the entire sub-
workflow result. The 'message' portion is the only part that is meaningful
to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1760659
Change-Id: I7eff355620aecaca49e77112ba491a5f3ce2eed6
(cherry picked from commit e25e8564a42d1074034a76da5412bea4fb77b414)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 19:15:46.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fix senlin configuration

Currently, [DEFAULT]:host in senlin config defaults to localhost,
and needs to point to the host of the senlin-engine. In OSH, as
the senlin-engine is in a separate pod with different url, this
needs to be updated since the rpc function between senlin-api
and senlin-engine breaks down.

Change-Id: Ic86d5e9f62fc30387ee617095da01f215158843b
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Fix senlin configuration

Currently, [DEFAULT]:host in senlin config defaults to localhost,
and needs to point to the host of the senlin-engine. In OSH, as
the senlin-engine is in a separate pod with different url, this
needs to be updated since the rpc function between senlin-api
and senlin-engine breaks down.

Change-Id: Ic86d5e9f62fc30387ee617095da01f215158843b
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Octavia amphora image handles updates and symlinks

This patch adds logic to the octavia image upload to update the
amphora image if a glance image of the same name already exists but has
a different checksum. It also adds some logic for distro specific
default behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1754039
Change-Id: I48ad8971e34ddebd50f5eb36e22a3d072e011d14

commit_message:
Nova: Update cell and db management

This PS updates the nova db and cell managment jobs to both be
compatible with queens and also add nodes dyanmically on a cron
job as they come online.

Change-Id: I3393f5ba82ac81b1a1da1e433c1c5158660ec97a

commit_message:
Disable validations for FFU job

With the CLI workflow for fast forward upgrade we need to disable
the validations while running overcloud ffwd-upgrade prepare to
bypass errors of not available hosts caused by the CI job using
predeployed servers.

Change-Id: I0e5e7736c0ef43dfdc53d9a4dc71c9c803cb6bde

commit_message:
Add time-bounded wait-for-status to func tests

Replace strategy of time.sleep(s_value) waiting for an image to
reach 'active' with a time-bounded wait-for-status loop function.
That way we can have a more generous s_value, which seems to
sometimes be needed in the gates, without having to use that much
time on every run.

I picked the initial s_value as 4x what was in the current code,
though given that some of the other gate tests run >1 hour, we could
easily make it 600 sec without lengthening the current minimum
time-to-verification of a patch.

Closes-bug: #1767142
Change-Id: Ib771079348d22212c7b6d90fa89e7fd4161422d3

commit_message:
Wire-in roles_file for undercloud heat installer

Undercloud deploy supports custom roles via --roles-file.
Maintain it in parity of that undercloud.conf supports.

Change-Id: I726f4191e931f85e8f4ed2a9ed5fb1ba9320fa4c
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make association_refresh configurable

The provider-tree refresh in the SchedulerReportClient() instance
of each compute node happens every five minutes as it is hard coded.
This patch adds this update interval as a new config option which
can be set/changed on each compute node.

Change-Id: I00f92aac44d7b0169f94940ef389796c782b0cc1
Closes-Bug: #1767309

> Can you please confirm that this package is also available on older

python-os-testr is available in all releases. https://github.com/redhat-openstack/rdoinfo/blob/master/rdo.yml#L5192. When tempest is runned using containers, os-testr is available with in container which comes a dependency [https://github.com/rdo-packages/tempest-distgit/blob/rpm-master/openstack-tempest.spec#L61] from openstack-tempest rpm. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 07:14:37.000000000', 'message': 'Install python-os-testr for subunit2html

* subunit2html is provided by python-os-testr and os-testr package is not
  available on undercloud which leads to failure to subunit2html command
  not found in tempest log.
* The above fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Id3c7688f97f1986514fb431ffc26e87a44341d7d
'}]
commit_message:
Install python-os-testr for subunit2html

* subunit2html is provided by python-os-testr and os-testr package is not
  available on undercloud which leads to failure to subunit2html command
  not found in tempest log.
* The above fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Id3c7688f97f1986514fb431ffc26e87a44341d7d

commit_message:
Containerize kubernetes-entrypoint image build

Containerizes the kubernetes-entrypoint image build so that go tooling
does not need to be pre-installed on the host.

Change-Id: I47766ef81f70170683e61c634411e259806932c5

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: Quota classes

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below quota classes API's

* PUT /v3/{admin_project_id}/os-quota-class-sets/{quota_class_name}

APIImpact : quota class update API will raise BadRequest(400) for
quota classes keys other than those accepted by quotas and
group_quotas resources.

Change-Id: Id7ac6ec88a4b0ea83131d929a9d607f2c4e3429b
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 19:57:54.000000000', 'message': 'support multiple member_of qparams for GET /r-ps

Adds a new placement API microversion that supports specifying multiple
member_of parameters to the GET /resource_providers endpoint. When
multiple member_of parameters are found, they are passed down to the
ResourceProviderList.get_by_filters() method as a list. Items in this
list are either an aggregate UUID or a list of aggregate UUIDs.

The list of member_of items is evaluated so that resource providers
matching ALL of the member_of constraints are returned.

When a member_of item is a list of UUIDs, we look up resource providers
that have *any* of those aggregate UUIDs associated with them.

Change-Id: Ib4f1955f06f2159dfb221f3d2bc8ff7bfce71ee2

commit_message:
support multiple member_of qparams

Adds a new placement API microversion that supports specifying multiple
member_of parameters to the GET /resource_providers and GET
/allocation_candidates API endpoints.

When multiple member_of parameters are found, they are passed down to
the ResourceProviderList.get_by_filters() method as a list. Items in
this list are lists of aggregate UUIDs.

The list of member_of items is evaluated so that resource providers
matching ALL of the member_of constraints are returned.

When a member_of item contains multiple UUIDs, we look up resource
providers that have *any* of those aggregate UUIDs associated with them.

Change-Id: Ib4f1955f06f2159dfb221f3d2bc8ff7bfce71ee2
blueprint: alloc-candidates-member-of

commit_message:
use root as the ansible_user in libvirt reproducer

I believe we want to use root to connect to
the virthost as we do elsewhere in tq.

Change-Id: Ie4359eb0e7aea178b78fdf8f7daaeeee8c876d73

commit_message:
Regenerate overcloudrc on upgrade and ffwd-upgrade (prepare)

This submission regenerate the overcloudrc file
when executing the upgrade prepare or the ffwd-upgrade prepare.

Closes-Bug: 1768036
Change-Id: If64e5f5fb329411ed8d7acd2235295ca924a90c5

commit_message:
create constellations repository

The TC is starting a new documentation initiative to help deployers
understand how to combine various OpenStack components for different
purposes. Although the TC is starting this, ultimately we hope to
build a team of maintainers for the repository and so a new gerrit
group is being used as the reviewers. We do not anticipate tagging or
branching, so those permissions are left as the defaults. We don't
know yet if this will remain a "TC-owned" repo or if the documentation
team will adopt it, so there is not yet a related governance patch.

Story: #2001702
Task: #15069
Change-Id: I0f7dccd1503b59d0e61eec00913bd96bf481184d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-27 12:16:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stable sphinx-docs job and pep8

This patch is a squash of two other patch that are needed to have a
successful stable job run:

1. Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break pep8 job
due to the new rules. This commit fixes the following new errors:

  - E711 comparison to None should be 'if cond is None:'
  - E402 module level import not at top of file
  - W503 line break before binary operator

(original Change-Id: I59b6682e6295ab77efc25c275b8a2b70923433db)

2. sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: Iedb91169e38d0bf111b581d4270af37ddafd7c1c
'}, {'created': '2018-04-27 13:31:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix stable sphinx-docs job and pep8

This patch is a squash of three other patch that are needed to have a
successful stable job run:

1. Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break pep8 job
due to the new rules. This commit fixes the following new errors:

  - E711 comparison to None should be 'if cond is None:'
  - E402 module level import not at top of file
  - W503 line break before binary operator

(original Change-Id: I59b6682e6295ab77efc25c275b8a2b70923433db)

2. Fix six.moves imports

pep8 job fails due to relative import issue at six.moves imports:
* Relative import 'six.moves.urllib', should be 'six.moves'
* Relative import 'six.moves.urllib.parse', should be 'six.moves'

3. sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: Iedb91169e38d0bf111b581d4270af37ddafd7c1c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stable sphinx-docs job and pep8

This patch is a squash of three other patch that are needed to have a
successful stable job run:

1. Fix pep8 errors

Recent pep8 upgrade and corresponding pycodestyle update break pep8 job
due to the new rules. This commit fixes the following new errors:

  - E711 comparison to None should be 'if cond is None:'
  - E402 module level import not at top of file
  - W503 line break before binary operator

(original Change-Id: I59b6682e6295ab77efc25c275b8a2b70923433db)

2. Fix six.moves imports

pep8 job fails due to relative import issue at six.moves imports:
* Relative import 'six.moves.urllib', should be 'six.moves'
* Relative import 'six.moves.urllib.parse', should be 'six.moves'

3. sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: Iedb91169e38d0bf111b581d4270af37ddafd7c1c

commit_message:
Allow to test Debian package on top of Ubuntu

The manifests/repos.pp uses ::operatingsystem. Let's make it use
$::os_package_type instead.

Change-Id: Iaa7987c86bf72810b0299335627478ba38839f4e

subject: gate(multinode): on installation don't pause unnecessarily
messages:
[{'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-05-03 00:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-05-03 14:19:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

In the gates, this seems to be resulting in a time reduction of ~1m - which I'm not sure is worth it as it loses the ability for us to confirm that the ceph charts have been isolated from each other - and would allow tight coupling to be re-introduced by accident."}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2018-05-03 17:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

moving away from gate scripts again'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 00:38:33.000000000', 'message': "gate(multinode): on installation don't pause unnecessarily

pausing between each chart makes things *much* slower and isn't
needed, we have working dependencies and making use of those means we
can wait just once after all charts have been installed

typically this means ceph is up and ready in under 2m (down from over
5m)

Change-Id: I91e7f07593c6cfbbc1bc078b4d40b17792faed4a
"}]
commit_message:
gate(multinode): on installation don't pause unnecessarily

pausing between each chart makes things *much* slower and isn't
needed, we have working dependencies and making use of those means we
can wait just once after all charts have been installed

typically this means ceph is up and ready in under 2m (down from over
5m)

Change-Id: I91e7f07593c6cfbbc1bc078b4d40b17792faed4a

commit_message:
Switch to using the cached version of CirrOS

We are timing out quite often download CirrOS and the OpenStack
infrastructure mirrors it already, this updates it to the correct
path.

Change-Id: I62b75777a74c6dcb7ccd65461558014e39a10991

commit_message:
Support actions for zun

Add ZunAction for zun. Zun is an OpenStack Container service. It aims to
provide an API service for running application containers without the
need to manage servers or clusters.

Change-Id: Ibbe4777528b5af6fdb3a6c2ed3345f8f9c804bef
Signed-off-by: pengdake <19921207pq@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I2027d59faacd0c00bc3ebeb15782eacfc4a3ce9f

[{'created': '2018-04-27 06:54:57.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure config-download mappings are unset on ceph-upgrade

Purpose is to ensure that any mapping previously used to enable
config-download is reset to perform a regular Heat stack update
on ceph-upgrade.

Change-Id: I52312ffcd438c354872ab3c74138b47ae71aab4b
'}, {'created': '2018-04-27 09:58:41.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure config-download mappings are unset on ceph-upgrade

Purpose is to ensure that any mapping previously used to enable
config-download is reset to perform a regular Heat stack update on
ceph-upgrade. We may need to do "update/upgrade/ffwd -> ceph ->
converge" instead of the previously assumed "update/upgrade/ffwd ->
converge -> ceph".

This also removes the no-op of DeploymentSteps -- we need them enabled
during Ceph upgrade as we need firewall rules applied.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1767318
Related-Bug: #1767317
Change-Id: I52312ffcd438c354872ab3c74138b47ae71aab4b
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure config-download mappings are unset on ceph-upgrade

Purpose is to ensure that any mapping previously used to enable
config-download is reset to perform a regular Heat stack update on
ceph-upgrade. We may need to do "update/upgrade/ffwd -> ceph ->
converge" instead of the previously assumed "update/upgrade/ffwd ->
converge -> ceph".

This also removes the no-op of DeploymentSteps -- we need them enabled
during Ceph upgrade as we need firewall rules applied.

Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1767318
Related-Bug: #1767317
Change-Id: I52312ffcd438c354872ab3c74138b47ae71aab4b

commit_message:
Introduce Ceph upgrade environments

These will disable OS::TripleO::DeploymentSteps on prepare, to allow
for a Heat stack update without triggering a puppet apply and then
restore the Heat resource and the Ceph ansible playbook on converge.

Change-Id: Ie765b429c4cb36d9dd616584cc1d4f45184fa1b8

commit_message:
Configure kuryr not creating SGs

Zun will manage security groups by itself so it is unnecessary for
kuryr to create additional security groups if it is used with Zun.
Disable it will significant improve the performance on
starting/stopping containers.

Depends-On: I6d6d176512e6b30bb7372408aec1a7bac12335ab
Change-Id: Ic281e17ef3920c0e85c3b52b97e1b43887040caf

commit_message:
Remove the project bandit from openstack

Ending project gating for the purposes of retiring the project
bandit according to steps in [1].

Bandit is migrating to PyCQA on GitHub as announced on the ML [2].
Details of the migration can be found on the etherpad here [3].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project
[2] https://openstack.markmail.org/message/w2gm256mt74v6ygf
[3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/bandit-migration

Change-Id: I4ae4f4a02f6a06665ae1c111514f9fb2c0db297a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-21 13:12:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix VF-rep lookup routine to use parent PF number

The current logic in get_representor_port() matches the VF number with
the one in 'phys_port_name' file. If and when multiple PFs on the same
card are configured in switchdev mode, we could end up returning a wrong
representor device. Fix this by including the parent PF number also in
this logic, when 'pfXvfY' (or vfY@pfX) format is used in 'phys_port_name'
file.

This patch also provides corresponding changes in unit tests. The tests
have been updated to validate 'phys_port_name' in 'pfXvfY' format (in
addition to the simple format - vfX or X). The test case for 2 PFs
specifically utilizes the 'pfXvfY' format, since otherwise it won't
be possible to disambiguate VFs with the same VF-ID under 2 PFs on the
same card (switch).

Change-Id: I5727878b63026a19fafcf7e71dda3ba480432fbf
Closes-Bug: #1743494
Signed-off-by: Sriharsha Basavapatna <sriharsha.basavapatna@broadcom.com>
(cherry picked from commit 84688a22db22039f5566c1439c3983db23672a45)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix VF-rep lookup routine to use parent PF number

The current logic in get_representor_port() matches the VF number with
the one in 'phys_port_name' file. If and when multiple PFs on the same
card are configured in switchdev mode, we could end up returning a wrong
representor device. Fix this by including the parent PF number also in
this logic, when 'pfXvfY' (or vfY@pfX) format is used in 'phys_port_name'
file.

This patch also provides corresponding changes in unit tests. The tests
have been updated to validate 'phys_port_name' in 'pfXvfY' format (in
addition to the simple format - vfX or X). The test case for 2 PFs
specifically utilizes the 'pfXvfY' format, since otherwise it won't
be possible to disambiguate VFs with the same VF-ID under 2 PFs on the
same card (switch).

Change-Id: I5727878b63026a19fafcf7e71dda3ba480432fbf
Closes-Bug: #1743494
Signed-off-by: Sriharsha Basavapatna <sriharsha.basavapatna@broadcom.com>
(cherry picked from commit 84688a22db22039f5566c1439c3983db23672a45)

[{'created': '2018-04-02 21:19:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use scheduler hints in derived_parameters workflow

Update the tripleo.derive_params.v1.derived_parameters workflow to use
scheduler hints associated with a given role. The scheduler hints are
used to identify overcloud nodes associated with the role, and take
precedence over nodes identified by their profile/flavor. If a role does

commit_message:
Use scheduler hints in derived_parameters workflow

Update the tripleo.derive_params.v1.derived_parameters workflow to use
scheduler hints associated with a given role. The scheduler hints are
used to identify overcloud nodes associated with the role, and take
precedence over nodes identified by their profile/flavor. If a role does
not specify any scheduler hints then the workflow falls back to matching
nodes by profile/flavor.

Add a tripleo.baremetal.v1.nodes_with_node_id workflow that searches
for ironic nodes matching a node placement regex. This workflow is
analogous to the existing nodes_with_profile workflow that searches
for nodes that match a given profile.

Add a tripleo.baremetal.get_node_id Mistral action that returns the node
placement ID (e.g. "controller-0") for a given node, or None if a node
ID is not defined. This is analogous to the existing get_profile action
that returns the profile assigned to the node.

Fix the 'message' published when a derived parameter sub-workflow fails
so it just returns the sub-workflow 'message' and not the entire sub-
workflow result. The 'message' portion is the only part that is meaningful
to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1760659
Change-Id: I7eff355620aecaca49e77112ba491a5f3ce2eed6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-30 18:55:41.000000000', 'message': 'Get anchors for sharing providers

Individual request groups (numbered or un-numbered) in a granular
resource request may be satisfied by a sharing provider.  In such cases,
we will need to be able to figure out which non-sharing trees the
sharing provider can be associated with.

This change introduces a helper method, _anchors_for_sharing_provider,
that accepts the ID of a sharing provider and returns the UUIDs of all
the unique root providers of trees associated with the same aggregate as
the sharing provider.

The sharing provider may or may not itself be part of a tree; in either
case, its root provider UUID is included in the result.

If the sharing provider is not part of any aggregate, the empty list is
returned.

blueprint: granular-resource-requests
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2cb4e95ca15caceb8713728f17630ed97059f25e

commit_message:
Get anchors for sharing providers

Individual request groups (numbered or un-numbered) in a granular
resource request may be satisfied by a sharing provider.  In such cases,
we will need to be able to figure out which non-sharing trees the
sharing provider can be associated with.

This change introduces a helper method, _anchors_for_sharing_provider,
that accepts the ID of a sharing provider and returns the UUIDs of all
the unique root providers of trees associated with the same aggregate as
the sharing provider.

The sharing provider may or may not itself be part of a tree; in either
case, its root provider UUID is included in the result.

If the sharing provider is not part of any aggregate, the empty list is
returned.

blueprint: granular-resource-requests
Co-Authored-By: Jay Pipes <jaypipes@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I2cb4e95ca15caceb8713728f17630ed97059f25e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 21:34:24.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Merge CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables into collect_nodes_uuid task

When deploying Ceph with tripleo/ceph-ansible a user may
override the ansible-playbook call environment varialbes by
using the CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables parameter. However,
this only affects the ceph-ansible playbook run, and not the
the playbook run which collects UUIDs from nodes. This change
merges the those same overrides into the collect UUID task.

Change-Id: Iae5eb968e1ad9abfc0572fb771af5236afb42dda
Closes-Bug: #1745108
'}, {'created': '2018-01-25 17:09:42.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Merge CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables into collect_nodes_uuid task

When deploying Ceph with tripleo/ceph-ansible a user may
override the ansible-playbook call environment varialbes by
using the CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables parameter. However,
this only affects the ceph-ansible playbook run, and not the
the playbook run which collects UUIDs from nodes. This change
merges the those same overrides into the collect UUID task.

Also uses the same CephAnsiblePlaybookVerbosity parameter.

Change-Id: Iae5eb968e1ad9abfc0572fb771af5236afb42dda
Closes-Bug: #1745108
'}, {'created': '2018-01-25 17:12:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Merge CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables into collect_nodes_uuid task

When deploying Ceph with tripleo/ceph-ansible a user may
override the ansible-playbook call environment varialbes by
using the CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables parameter. However,
this only affects the ceph-ansible playbook run, and not the
the playbook run which collects UUIDs from nodes. This change
merges the those same overrides into the collect UUID task.

Also uses the same CephAnsiblePlaybookVerbosity parameter.

Change-Id: Iae5eb968e1ad9abfc0572fb771af5236afb42dda
Closes-Bug: #1745108
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Merge CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables into collect_nodes_uuid task

When deploying Ceph with tripleo/ceph-ansible a user may
override the ansible-playbook call environment varialbes by
using the CephAnsibleEnvironmentVariables parameter. However,
this only affects the ceph-ansible playbook run, and not the
the playbook run which collects UUIDs from nodes. This change
merges the those same overrides into the collect UUID task.

Also uses the same CephAnsiblePlaybookVerbosity parameter.

Change-Id: Iae5eb968e1ad9abfc0572fb771af5236afb42dda
Closes-Bug: #1745108

commit_message:
use neutron-lib plugin utils

The remainder of neutron.plugins.common.utils is now in neutron-lib.
This patch consumes it in prep for the corresponding neutron commit
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565284

It also bumps neutron-lib up to 1.14.0

Change-Id: I9fe258cf59c5096e9466438adeab0184deb70eb1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 14:10:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add preliminary support for Monasca APIs

If one deploys the Monasca APIs using the in-review patches
for upstream kolla-ansible, the Monasca API sections do not
exist in the Kayobe overcloud inventory causing HAProxy
configuration via Kayobe to fail.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I4ba4c3e9136219bb48ec7a14bb78a7024850c7e6
'}]
commit_message:
Add preliminary support for Monasca APIs

If one deploys the Monasca APIs using the in-review patches
for upstream kolla-ansible, the Monasca API sections do not
exist in the Kayobe overcloud inventory causing HAProxy
configuration via Kayobe to fail.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I4ba4c3e9136219bb48ec7a14bb78a7024850c7e6

subject: Spec for splitting plugins code from Sahara core
messages:
[{'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-03-15 17:53:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

and what about requirements management? for example let's say a 2018 Sahara uses a 2020 sahara-plugins release... we could end up with wedged requirements. although some of the talk on the mailing list about requirements right now does seem like it would partially help avoid this kind of problem"}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-03-16 13:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-03-21 21:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-04-17 19:02:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-04-27 16:01:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think that my points received an answer, but Jeremy's ones may still need some clarification."}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-04-30 11:44:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I think that my points received an answer, but Jeremy's ones may
 > still need some clarification.

You mean about the requirements?"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-04-30 12:08:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > I think that my points received an answer, but Jeremy's ones may
 > > still need some clarification.
 > 
 > You mean about the requirements?

Uhm, it should be fine. The point about requirements should be covered now that we have lower-requirements.txt, even if we may do intermediate releases if we introduce a new feature in the plugins API which is needed by the plugins. 

About the other point and Image packing, I totally missed the section. Maybe few additional words about it? The API would need to provide also some hooks for the image packing functions. Or maybe it's just part of the rest of the documentation.
(maybe with the refactoring we could introduce a way to define the image version used for image pack which is different from the plugin  version used as tag; useful for example for Ambari/HDP)."}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-05-03 15:01:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I think we've said enough in the spec"}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-05-03 15:51:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's go then"}]

commit_message:
Spec for splitting plugins code from Sahara core

In order to have an easier set up for users to keep plugins versions up
to date we are proposing the split of plugins code from sahara core into
its own project.

Change-Id: Ib50311a129e17e2fbb7ae0d53c6ebe9c9f668709

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-27 15:37:59.000000000', 'message': 'Don't unregister on system/resource delete

Don't unregister systems from the portal/satellite
when deleting from Heat. There are several reasons why
it's compelling to fix this behavior. See
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1710144
for full information. The previous behavior can be triggered
by setting the DeleteOnRHELUnregistration parameter to "true".

Closes-Bug: #1710144
Change-Id: I909a6f7a049dc23fc27f2231a4893d428f06a1f1
(cherry picked from commit 35ed6c6065b1e263eb69725e71639a6ea6d54cc7)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't unregister on system/resource delete

Don't unregister systems from the portal/satellite
when deleting from Heat. There are several reasons why
it's compelling to fix this behavior. See
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1710144
for full information. The previous behavior can be triggered
by setting the DeleteOnRHELUnregistration parameter to "true".

Closes-Bug: #1710144
Change-Id: I909a6f7a049dc23fc27f2231a4893d428f06a1f1
(cherry picked from commit 35ed6c6065b1e263eb69725e71639a6ea6d54cc7)

commit_message:
Remove the duplicate check and update

The target power state and last error check and update are done
in function 'node_power_action'. They will also be updated when
an error happens before 'node_power_action' is really called in
'power_state_error_handler' hook function. So remove the duplicate
target power state and last error update in the previous code
which will update again in 'node_power_action' or
'power_state_error_handler'.

Change-Id: Ia6c2dc2d106566092b13135df01956ba7c43019a
Closes-Bug: #1531437

commit_message:
Fix mariadb recover seqnum regex

Regex used to find the recover seqnum partition is not
returning the real num id rather a None.
Task fails due seqnum[0] is not iterable.

Change-Id: I1be55b6ebfc17c6d423e638662ec2a9f4b9b49a2
Closes-Bug: #1752128
(cherry picked from commit 8a63c801c673a3c9f202f198091c4e41b3f4033c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-02 08:21:35.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Make `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive for real

When we introduced `cpu_model_extra_flags` config attribute (in
commit: 6b601b7 -- "libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature
flags"), we said it was case-insensitive; but unfortunately I missed to
_really_ make it so (despite proposing code for it in one of the
revisions).

Address that mistake by making `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive
for real, from Nova's point of view.

NB: Internally, this patch is normalizing 'extra_flags' to _lower_
casing -- because CPU flags _must_ be lower case from libvirt's point of
view.  Nova must honour that; otherwise, launching instances with an
upper case CPU flag, 'FOO', will fail with: "libvirtError: internal
error: Unknown CPU feature FOO".

Related-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: Ia7ff0566a5109c76c009f3a0c6199c4ba419cfb1
Reported-by: Daniel P. Berrang <berrange@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8e438eda9bb16cdd3b627b93da2435572275b921)
'}, {'created': '2018-05-03 10:59:25.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Make `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive for real

When we introduced `cpu_model_extra_flags` config attribute (in
commit: 6b601b7 -- "libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature
flags"), we said it was case-insensitive; but unfortunately I missed to
_really_ make it so (despite proposing code for it in one of the
revisions).

Address that mistake by making `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive
for real, from Nova's point of view.

NB: Internally, this patch is normalizing 'extra_flags' to _lower_
casing -- because CPU flags _must_ be lower case from libvirt's point of
view.  Nova must honour that; otherwise, launching instances with an
upper case CPU flag, 'FOO', will fail with: "libvirtError: internal
error: Unknown CPU feature FOO".

Related-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: Ia7ff0566a5109c76c009f3a0c6199c4ba419cfb1
Reported-by: Daniel P. Berrang <berrange@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8e438eda9bb16cdd3b627b93da2435572275b921)
(cherry picked from commit f9ab466c6d9bb657409356f29139a9edfbb98747)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Make `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive for real

When we introduced `cpu_model_extra_flags` config attribute (in
commit: 6b601b7 -- "libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature
flags"), we said it was case-insensitive; but unfortunately I missed to
_really_ make it so (despite proposing code for it in one of the
revisions).

Address that mistake by making `cpu_model_extra_flags` case-insensitive
for real, from Nova's point of view.

NB: Internally, this patch is normalizing 'extra_flags' to _lower_
casing -- because CPU flags _must_ be lower case from libvirt's point of
view.  Nova must honour that; otherwise, launching instances with an
upper case CPU flag, 'FOO', will fail with: "libvirtError: internal
error: Unknown CPU feature FOO".

Related-Bug: #1750829
Change-Id: Ia7ff0566a5109c76c009f3a0c6199c4ba419cfb1
Reported-by: Daniel P. Berrang <berrange@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8e438eda9bb16cdd3b627b93da2435572275b921)
(cherry picked from commit f9ab466c6d9bb657409356f29139a9edfbb98747)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 14:41:07.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly set nova/neutron/ceilometer host to expected fqdn

This avoids any issues where the host/domainname is altered by a DHCP lease.
Also the puppet/facter fqdn can be unpredictable when there are multiple NICs.

commit_message:
Explicitly set nova/neutron/ceilometer host to expected fqdn

This avoids any issues where the host/domainname is altered by a DHCP lease.
Also the puppet/facter fqdn can be unpredictable when there are multiple NICs.

Change-Id: I7ed52727d1515ee7f191a82b0b1d645a9d597cd3
Closes-bug: 1758034
(cherry picked from commit 31e4c0194dd1d6e049a728c876347df93ce89908)
(cherry picked from commit 3381d59f0a6bafac47c98ed8754ee4170e749354)
(cherry picked from commit c48ae0b42f06dacd8615ef52f718674ec95c12af)
(cherry picked from commit 7df20fd5738e9c00a4daf7e4f633c634f3b81f69)

Config typo in external Ceph guide

The documentation for integration with external Ceph refers to
enable_manila_backend_ceph_native where it should be
enable_manila_backend_cephfs_native.

commit_message:
Add ansible docker role to base_centos_binary_packages

We are switching to Ansible for deploying Docker (instead of
puppet-tripleo), so we need the role part of the containers where
puppet-tripleo used to be deployed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 18:25:27.000000000', 'message': 'Run ironic_dnsmasq with privileged=true

When attempting to boot a node with ironic, it seems at times
ironic_dnsmasq fails to process dhcp bootp requests, giving the
following error repeating:

dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPDISCOVER(eth0) 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPOFFER(eth0) 192.169.5.100 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: ARP-cache injection failed: Operation not permitted

Running the container as privileged fixes this.

Change-Id: I39acb81801710f849336380d3fde01c70cd8d8ce
Closes-Bug: #1762805
'}, {'created': '2018-04-19 11:03:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add cap NET_ADMIN for ironic_dnsmasq

When attempting to inspect a node with ironic, it seems at times
ironic_dnsmasq fails to process dhcp bootp requests, giving the
following error repeating:

dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPDISCOVER(eth0) 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPOFFER(eth0) 192.169.5.100 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: ARP-cache injection failed: Operation not permitted

Adding NET_ADMIN fixes this.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1762805
Change-Id: I39acb81801710f849336380d3fde01c70cd8d8ce
'}, {'created': '2018-04-30 13:47:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add cap NET_ADMIN for ironic_dnsmasq

When attempting to inspect a node with ironic, it seems at times
ironic_dnsmasq fails to process dhcp bootp requests, giving the

dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPDISCOVER(eth0) 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPOFFER(eth0) 192.169.5.100 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: ARP-cache injection failed: Operation not permitted

Adding NET_ADMIN fixes this.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1762805
Change-Id: I39acb81801710f849336380d3fde01c70cd8d8ce
'}]
commit_message:
Add cap NET_ADMIN for ironic_dnsmasq

When attempting to inspect a node with ironic, it seems at times
ironic_dnsmasq fails to process dhcp bootp requests, giving the
following error repeating:

dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPDISCOVER(eth0) 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: DHCPOFFER(eth0) 192.169.5.100 52:54:00:ff:15:55
dnsmasq-dhcp: ARP-cache injection failed: Operation not permitted

Adding NET_ADMIN fixes this.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Closes-Bug: #1762805
Change-Id: I39acb81801710f849336380d3fde01c70cd8d8ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 13:55:50.000000000', 'message': 'remove lru cache from gerrit review lookup

We pre-process the list of reviews to ensure they are unique, so we
should only be reading a given review once. Keeping a disk cache makes
sense, but a memory cache just uses more memory.

Change-Id: I106ac4d7b7b3f1d09b002dd6bec7eabccc60cbb4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove lru cache from gerrit review lookup

We pre-process the list of reviews to ensure they are unique, so we
should only be reading a given review once. Keeping a disk cache makes
sense, but a memory cache just uses more memory.

Change-Id: I106ac4d7b7b3f1d09b002dd6bec7eabccc60cbb4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Release 0.1.1
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 14:10:35.000000000', 'message': 'Release 0.1.1

This tag adds the following functionalities:
  - Include ssl certificates
  - port pools tests.

Even if the plugin is branchless due to reqs this would be the final tag
to be used against stable/queens main repos.

Change-Id: I39b16a1fc70dbaea2302ba1847ff2c0452cf8659
'}]
commit_message:
Release 0.1.1

This tag adds the following functionalities:
  - Include ssl certificates
  - port pools tests.

Even if the plugin is branchless due to reqs this would be the final tag
to be used against stable/queens main repos.

Change-Id: I39b16a1fc70dbaea2302ba1847ff2c0452cf8659

commit_message:
Trivial: Update pypi url to new url

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

Change-Id: Idf7bf448a1066d343c8db95e94c01310d943c6ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 16:31:13.000000000', 'message': 'Make service all-cells min version helper use scatter-gather

This makes the Service get_minimum_version_all_cells() helper use the parallel
scatter-gather utilities to make the determination. It also adds fault handling
for cases where a cell fails to respond, and an option to ignore or raise in
that situation.

Change-Id: I62dc1033437f91bded28a9fd58759d2dbd7e55fb

commit_message:
Make service all-cells min version helper use scatter-gather

This makes the Service get_minimum_version_all_cells() helper use the parallel
scatter-gather utilities to make the determination. It also adds fault handling
for cases where a cell fails to respond, and an option to ignore or raise in
that situation.

Closes-Bug: #1746558
Change-Id: I62dc1033437f91bded28a9fd58759d2dbd7e55fb

commit_message:
Make host_manager use scatter-gather and ignore down cells

This makes the host_manager query for computes in parallel across all the
cells. It also ignores cells that fail or time out so that scheduling can
proceed.

Closes-Bug: #1746561
Change-Id: I48d8b763f475c010fa48ee1db232a6d3ae75f5e6

commit_message:
Release 0.1.1

This tag adds the following functionalities:
  - Include ssl certificates
  - port pools tests.

Even if the plugin is branchless due to reqs this would be the final tag
to be used against stable/queens main repos.

Change-Id: I66ccd4b833d88b2e8f0e5a30e83bda68d2fe9a4f

commit_message:
Update install guide to require resource classes

This removes some nova config recommendations for property-based
scheduling, as they shouldn't be used any longer. It also updates the
flavor creation document to only focus on resource classes. Last, update
the nova commands in the flavor creation document to be openstackclient
commands.

Change-Id: Ib4512ad707964a2d06b7a8428b89020b05cff0b2

commit_message:
Allow using the fake-hardware hardware type for API tests

Currently we only allow the fake classic driver. Also correct the help
string of the [baremetal]driver option, since it's very misleading.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-03 12:23:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lxc cache prep resolvers

Recent changes in the upstream LXC images have resulted in breakage
caused by busted symlinks, likely to the image moving to
"systemd-resolved". This change backports the process we use in master
to create the cache resolvers which will ensure we're not having to deal
with this issue.

Change-Id: I3769053956b958a0ac7cab499ea90af2a40de850
Related-Change: I1775e775bbb7fe86bdffdd8296c2cff5ebc5bac8
Closes-Bug: #1768592
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e77c3a923bc8aae4a264917f592b58b5d1c79aed)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lxc cache prep resolvers

Recent changes in the upstream LXC images have resulted in breakage
caused by busted symlinks, likely to the image moving to
"systemd-resolved". This change backports the process we use in master
to create the cache resolvers which will ensure we're not having to deal
with this issue.

Change-Id: I3769053956b958a0ac7cab499ea90af2a40de850
Related-Change: I1775e775bbb7fe86bdffdd8296c2cff5ebc5bac8
Closes-Bug: #1768592
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e77c3a923bc8aae4a264917f592b58b5d1c79aed)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 09:46:54.000000000', 'message': 'undercloud: automatic migration for classic drivers to hardware types

The new online data migration in ironic will migrate nodes from classic drivers
to hardware types. However, it will skip nodes with one or more target
hardware interfaces not enabled. In the undercloud we don't enable certain
implementations that we do not support (e.g. "agent" RAID and
"ipmitool-shellinabox" console for the "ipmi" hardware type).
To allow the migration to work, set a special option to reset these
interfaces to their no-op equivalents ("no-raid", "no-console", etc).

A new parameter IronicOnlineDataMigrationsParams can be used to achieve
the same in the overcloud (off by default, as it may yield unexpected
results on some configurations).

Change-Id: Iba1e82d47c0e22613b06b99f0a9d0f4b3082bbe7
Related-Bug: #1690185
'}, {'created': '2018-03-18 20:21:31.000000000', 'message': 'undercloud: automatic migration for classic drivers to hardware types

The new online data migration in ironic will migrate nodes from classic drivers
to hardware types. However, it will skip nodes with one or more target
hardware interfaces not enabled. In the undercloud we don't enable certain
implementations that we do not support (e.g. "agent" RAID and
"ipmitool-shellinabox" console for the "ipmi" hardware type).
To allow the migration to work, set a special option to reset these
interfaces to their no-op equivalents ("no-raid", "no-console", etc).

A new parameter IronicOnlineDataMigrationsParams can be used to achieve
the same in the overcloud (off by default, as it may yield unexpected
results on some configurations).

Change-Id: Iba1e82d47c0e22613b06b99f0a9d0f4b3082bbe7
Related-Bug: #1690185
'}]
commit_message:
undercloud: automatic migration for classic drivers to hardware types

The new online data migration in ironic will migrate nodes from classic drivers
to hardware types. However, it will skip nodes with one or more target
hardware interfaces not enabled. In the undercloud we don't enable certain
implementations that we do not support (e.g. "agent" RAID and
"ipmitool-shellinabox" console for the "ipmi" hardware type).
To allow the migration to work, set a special option to reset these
interfaces to their no-op equivalents ("no-raid", "no-console", etc).

A new parameter IronicOnlineDataMigrationsParams can be used to achieve
the same in the overcloud (off by default, as it may yield unexpected
results on some configurations).

Change-Id: Iba1e82d47c0e22613b06b99f0a9d0f4b3082bbe7
Related-Bug: #1690185

commit_message:
Update OpenWrt Guide

To check DHCP and DNS rules, we use "cat /etc/config/dhcp"
instead of "cat /etc/config/dnsmasq"

This patch also adds user and password note.

Change-Id: Ifd68d641f30f04ec598c4fbd1c569b41f0076ca3

commit_message:
Do not clone role being tested as a dep outside openstack-ci

When executing the clones outside of openstack-ci, we should
verify that we're not cloning the role repository for the role
we are testing because we already have it.

Change-Id: Ibc64fc5c97f0b711934eb3e297159b0d38587647

As we discovered bug #1768586 we'll need to make sure that every
parameter tweak in plan is followed by a stack update.

So far the Ceph upgrade command did set param -> stack update -> unset
param (only in plan). However this means the last CephAnsiblePlaybook
setting (back to normal deploy playbook) was discarded.

We could make Ceph upgrade command do one more stack update to make
the parameter take effect, but it is better to just not do any
"converge" in the Ceph command and rely on the update/upgrade/ffwd
converges to set the correct CephAnsiblePlaybook. This means that we
won't do more stack updates than necessary, and at the same time the
user workflow stays somewhat consistent between envs that do and don't
have Ceph.

An alternative would be to run the as part of the Ceph command, but
that either means we'd have to run one more stack update then
necessary, or skip the last converge in envs with Ceph, and
essentially diverge further from the non-Ceph workflow.

Change-Id: I7a42f10146a83167243a3258fdf166207f405224
Related-Bug: #1768586
'}]
commit_message:
Set normal CephAnsiblePlaybook on update/upgrade/ffwd converge

As we discovered bug #1768586 we'll need to make sure that every
parameter tweak in plan is followed by a stack update.

So far the Ceph upgrade command did set param -> stack update -> unset
param (only in plan). However this means the last CephAnsiblePlaybook
setting (back to normal deploy playbook) was discarded.

We could make Ceph upgrade command do one more stack update to make
the parameter take effect, but it is better to just not do any
"converge" in the Ceph command and rely on the update/upgrade/ffwd
converges to set the correct CephAnsiblePlaybook. This means that we
won't do more stack updates than necessary, and at the same time the
user workflow stays somewhat consistent between envs that do and don't
have Ceph.

An alternative would be to run the as part of the Ceph command, but
that either means we'd have to run one more stack update then
necessary, or skip the last converge in envs with Ceph, and
essentially diverge further from the non-Ceph workflow.

Change-Id: I7a42f10146a83167243a3258fdf166207f405224
Related-Bug: #1768586

[{'created': '2018-04-30 18:35:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the (now obsolete) pip-missing-reqs tox target

The test does not work anymore with pip 10. For more details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/130027.html

(I suspect that the development that happened later in OpenStack testing
made it obsolete anyway).

Change-Id: I2227e70d23e5e7e99a85834ccc7d6ec8a09bf4ae
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the (now obsolete) pip-missing-reqs tox target

The test does not work anymore with pip 10. For more details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/130027.html

(I suspect that the development that happened later in OpenStack testing
made it obsolete anyway).

Change-Id: I2227e70d23e5e7e99a85834ccc7d6ec8a09bf4ae

(5 comments)

Hi, Thanks for the reivew. I agree, that adding different example files for every extension looks strange. Would it be okay if I add back the qos policy parameters to the original examples and drescribe that they are there only if the qos extension is used?'}, {'account_id': 21723, 'date': '2017-11-08 04:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

I had a short chat with Armando in the Summit and we agreed, that I submit a patch where I have the qos parameter in the original examples and explicitly write down, that they are there only if the qos service plugin is activated.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-11-08 13:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Here's what we've been doing to date::

- Each resource extension is called out in a subsection under the respective resource API it extends. This section describes high-level what the ext does and calls out all attrs it adds to the resource (or perhaps a subresource).
- The ext resource attrs are just documented as normal params in the API. We haven't been making any special notes about them per say. Users know they are ext attrs by reading the ext subsection as per bullet 1 above.
- The ext attrs are added to the existing JSON sample request/responses. Nothing special is done to note them per say.


For example [1].


So with that in mind, I'm not sure what's meant by "and explicitly write down, that they are there only if the qos service plugin is activated". If it means what I outlined above; great.
If not, I'd like to understand why we want to change how we've been docing these to date and what the plans are to make the existing consistent with a new approach.

commit_message:
Adding qos policy to the different port and network operations

The qos policy parameter was missing from the request and the
response of the different port and network operations.
This change adds them.

Closes-Bug: 1735093
Change-Id: I8c665a9eec4f627b97af4d937f49afdd7bd60fc7
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-03 01:57:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lxc cache prep resolvers

Recent changes in the upstream LXC images have resulted in breakage
caused by busted symlinks, likely to the image moving to
"systemd-resolved". This change backports the process we use in master
to create the cache resolvers which will ensure we're not having to deal
with this issue.

Change-Id: I3769053956b958a0ac7cab499ea90af2a40de850
Related-Change: I1775e775bbb7fe86bdffdd8296c2cff5ebc5bac8
Closes-Bug: #1768592

commit_message:
Fix lxc cache prep resolvers

Recent changes in the upstream LXC images have resulted in breakage
caused by busted symlinks, likely to the image moving to
"systemd-resolved". This change backports the process we use in master
to create the cache resolvers which will ensure we're not having to deal
with this issue.

Change-Id: I3769053956b958a0ac7cab499ea90af2a40de850
Related-Change: I1775e775bbb7fe86bdffdd8296c2cff5ebc5bac8
Closes-Bug: #1768592
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I860a8776bb32e8e05abd914110ca8df24d869bd2

On ONTAP NFS driver, the export path was being used as the volume
name. If the export path is different than the volume name, the
API call to delete files would fail and the driver would invoke
a fallback method that deletes the files manually. This patch fixes
that by finding the correct volume name.

API call to delete files would fail and the driver would invoke

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix export path used as volume name

On ONTAP NFS driver, the export path was being used as the volume
name. If the export path is different than the volume name, the
API call to delete files would fail and the driver would invoke
a fallback method that deletes the files manually. This patch fixes
that by finding the correct volume name.

(cherry-picked from commit 64df0693991bd3815acc8e445da912a499198f7e)
Change-Id: Ice78889573a36ff5e8873a0d316ddcf180d0263f
Closes-bug: #1690954

commit_message:
Adds egress and ingress forward rules for trusted ports

Iptables firewall driver now adds rules for trusted ports to FORWARD
chain in EGRESS and INGRESS directions.
Unfiltered and trusted port rules are too wide. We have to match
traffic against security groups first.

Change-Id: I61e4dc92669e33a207adfb72a1692184884143e1
Closes-Bug: #1762736

there is no restriction on length.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 12:08:45.000000000', 'message': 'Include only required fields in ironic node cache

The ironic virt driver maintains a cache of ironic nodes to avoid
continually polling the ironic API.  Code paths requiring a specific
node use a limited set of fields, _NODE_FIELDS, when querying the
ironic API for the node. This reduces the memory footprint required by
the cache, and the network traffic required to populate it. However,
in most cases the cache is populated using a detailed node list
operation in _refresh_cache(), which includes all node fields.

This change specifies _NODE_FIELDS in the node list operation in
_refresh_cache().

We also modify the unit tests to use fake node objects that are
representative of the nodes in the cache.

Change-Id: Id96e7e513f469b87992ddae1431cce714e91ed16
Related-Bug: #1746209
'}, {'created': '2018-04-03 13:41:37.000000000', 'message': 'Include only required fields in ironic node cache

The ironic virt driver maintains a cache of ironic nodes to avoid
continually polling the ironic API.  Code paths requiring a specific
node use a limited set of fields, _NODE_FIELDS, when querying the
ironic API for the node. This reduces the memory footprint required by
the cache, and the network traffic required to populate it. However,
in most cases the cache is populated using a detailed node list
operation in _refresh_cache(), which includes all node fields.

This change specifies _NODE_FIELDS in the node list operation in
_refresh_cache().

We also modify the unit tests to use fake node objects that are
representative of the nodes in the cache.

Change-Id: Id96e7e513f469b87992ddae1431cce714e91ed16
Related-Bug: #1746209
'}]
commit_message:
Include only required fields in ironic node cache

The ironic virt driver maintains a cache of ironic nodes to avoid
continually polling the ironic API.  Code paths requiring a specific
node use a limited set of fields, _NODE_FIELDS, when querying the
ironic API for the node. This reduces the memory footprint required by
the cache, and the network traffic required to populate it. However,
in most cases the cache is populated using a detailed node list
operation in _refresh_cache(), which includes all node fields.

This change specifies _NODE_FIELDS in the node list operation in
_refresh_cache().

We also modify the unit tests to use fake node objects that are
representative of the nodes in the cache.

Change-Id: Id96e7e513f469b87992ddae1431cce714e91ed16
Related-Bug: #1746209

commit_message:
Copy undercloud templates for mixed upgrade.

Until now the task in charge of copying the
tripleo-heat-templates to upgrade to in the
TripleO CI was included in the main playbook [0].

In order to remove this tech debt, we need to
include the task withing the tripleo-upgrade role
to avoid running tasks withing the playbook, only
roles being allowed.

[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542311/26/

Change-Id: If3d15e609b4f6770ea163d6c5323d8a758142715
Related-Bug: #1749740

commit_message:
Add scenario for testing ironic without glance

In kilo release it was made possible for ironic to download images
from http servers and from conductor filesystem. This change adds a
scenario testing usecase of deploying nodes with ironic, with images
located outside of glance.

Change-Id: Ia850b85a204d291ce3ced1f30706131bf125d3ac

commit_message:
Add resource classes integration tests

This change adds two tempest integration tests for the resource
classes reporting in nova. These tests create fake nodes with
minimal compute resources and random resource classes and check
that the corresponding inventories are reported in the placement
API. We also include a minimal version of the placement API
client, as there is no plan at the moment to have a generic one
in tempest.

Related-Bug: #1604916

Change-Id: I28f8135728ac2b537dac4e65e22e1625e68704b6

commit_message:
Move netowrk interface calls to conductor

This change moves all the network interface calls from inside the
deploy interfaces to the conductor, to provide better functional
isolation between interfaces and improve interchangeability of
deploy interfaces.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1679834
Change-Id: I60fef281d5b73f3f491f370f907bb84501be71e7

So, the main reason why I did propose it was the notifications implementation. If conductor triggers the network interface, it can contain all the logic needed for event processing. If we do it inside deploy drivers, we might need to add some code regarding event processing too. Maybe it can be worked around with decorators though. So I'm OK with whatever people think of this."}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-09-25 05:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Better driver interface isolation

commit_message:
Remove references to Exact* filters

The nova-scheduler Exact* filters were deprecated in Pike
and are being removed in Rocky. This removes the references
to the Exact* filters. As a result, use_baremetal_filters=True
is also removed since removing the Exact filters also means
there would be no enabled baremetal filters, so
use_baremetal_filters needs to be False (its default value).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/508886/
Change-Id: I16ec401a864d3732f952071b3858a6f60123276f

commit_message:
Change minimum pecan version to 1.1.1

pecan 1.1.1 was release on June 3, 2016, so it should be
safe to move forward to it.  Should clean-up a lot of
these warnings:

DeprecationWarning: inspect.getargspec() is deprecated,
use inspect.signature() instead

Change-Id: I948cbc537123b6a0bcc781d1d7b5ac09895c3851

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on all branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to pip.

Change-Id: I76f6c07bbb938d0eaeefc1bc9c8c383e2ca48e09
